I would help thee... but alas, I am stuck in here...
I have no quarrel with thee ~1_NAME~.  Make haste and leave this place lest I change my mind.
Greetings, ~1_NAME~! Thank the heavens you have arrived!
The island has been plagued with vile creatures for some time now and the villagers need your help destroying them. Will you accept?
Welcome, stranger! I am known as Uzeraan the Conjurer and I am the lord of this house.  I was beginning to worry that you wouldn't come..
Alas, you came and not a minute too soon.  I am unable to leave this house and have some urgent tasks that I need completed...please - come.
Thank you kind stranger! You have freed me.  I knew you could do it.
Now I must return to my home, surely my family is worried sick over my disappearance.
It seems by unlocking the door, you lifted the anti-magic aura of the cage.
Well done! Teach them a lesson!
I would help thee... but alas, I am stuck in here...
That will teach the evil swine to reconsider his evil ways!
HA! Excellent move on thy part!
They are not match for thee. Show no mercy!
Find Uzeraan.  Uzeraan will explain what you need to do next.
Uzeraan says:  Hello! I am the grand Conjurer, Uzeraan. I have a few tasks for you to perform.
You have arrived not a moment too soon, stranger.  Terrible things have happened and we need your help!
This island has been plagued with foul creatures ever since the mysterious dark force began its invasion.
I know we have just met, but our need is dire and I must ask of you a favor.
For some time now, our hunters have been disappearing in the forests of this island.
We believe vile 'Shadow Wisps' are responsible for these disappearances.
Go forth and kill at least 6 of these 'Shadow Wisps'. See if you can find any evidence of our missing men.
Well done! You have completed your task of slaying the 'Shadow Wisps'.
Return to Uzeraan and tell him of your findings.  He is no doubt eagerly awaiting your return.
Return to Uzeraan and tell him of your findings.
Uzeraan gives you a somber look and begins to speak slowly:
You bring sad news stranger and I fear our men may be lost forever. They will be mourned.
You, however, have shown great Valor in your battle against the wretched 'Shadow Wisps'. I am pleased.
For your efforts I have placed a small token of my appreciation in your backpack.
Unfortunately, I have more disturbing news. We once had an underground cavern that we used for mining ore.
It seems horrible creatures have been emerging from the caves at night, terrorizing the villagers.
In their folly, a mob of frightened villagers collapsed the entrance to the mining cave.
The villagers did not know that I had recently installed a teleporter in the cave.  It was designed to give the workers a quick way to return home from the cave.
What's worse is that this teleporter only goes one way: Out of the cave, into our village.
The horrid phantasms still haunt us on a nightly basis using MY teleporter to get here. We have no way to get into the cave!
Well - there is one way. Let me tell you something of magic travel...
To begin with, you need what is called a runa.  Blank runas can be purchased at most any magic supply shop.
Then, you need either in your spellbook, or inscribed on a scroll a 'Mark' spell. 'Tis a spell of the 6th circle.
You then cast the Mark spell and target the runa. This inscribes the rune with the location at which you are standing.
To instantly return to the location where the rune was marked, you employ the 'Recall' spell.
This spell is of the 4th circle and you should have little trouble with it.
Simply cast the Recall spell and target the marked runa of the location you wish to travel to.
There is also another, called 'Gate Travel' which operates on the same principles as the Recall spell.
Gate Travel allows you to open a magical gate to the location of your marked runa. This way, others can travel with you.
Gate Travel is of the 7th circle however, and you will not be able to weave such intricate magic for a while.
Now - to get back to the subject at hand.  Whilst I was working in the caves, installing the teleporter, I marked a rune.
This would, in theory, allow us to travel into the cave to investigate the condition of our mining resources.
Unfortunately, to cast any spell, one must have the necessary reagents. Reagents that I do not have.
My supply of Mandrake Root has run dry and so I cannot cast any of the magic travel spells needed to enter the cave.
I must ask of you to go and gather Mandrake Root for me.  Try the reagent shops if you have money, or find another way if you do not.
I have no money for reagents to give you at this time, but be assured that I will repay you.
Please hurry - time is short and so is our supply of fighters to fend off the wicked creatures.
Uzeraan nods at you with approval and begins to speak:
Thank you stranger. You are not a moment too soon. For your help I have placed a few scrolls in your pack to aid you.
Just a few Mark and Recall scrolls for you to try out. I've also given you some blank runas.
Now I can send the few remaining soldiers in to the cave to investigate the state of affairs.
On second thought, *YOU* would do much better against the wretched wraiths than any of our soldiers.
Go and gather any other supplies you think you will need and then return here. I will transport you below upon your return.
I was beginning to think you would not return. I am glad to see that I was mistaken.
Go now into the caves below and find out what you can about the creatures coming from there.
Slay 6 of the creatures and gather any information on their weaknesses that you can.
Remember that there is a teleporter somewhere in the cave that will lead back to the surface.
Mission Complete.  You have slain the restless souls as instructed. Return to Uzeraan to report.
Uzeraan looks very disturbed at your report.  After a long silence he speaks to you:
It seems the caves are lost to us as the restless souls you describe have made it their new home.
The villagers wanted me to thank you for your help and have given me some items to reward you with.
I have placed some reagents, a few scrolls and some gold in your pack.
The issue of the restless souls requires more investigation, but alas, a more pressing matter has surfaced.
My friend and associate, Aegis The Archmage of Moonglow, has been secretly working on a new spell formula.
The new spell would easily swing the tides in our favor in the battle against this unknown evil that has befallen us.
Apparently, many of Aegis' apprentices have been getting abducted in an attempt to force information from them.
I have just received word from Aegis that one of his most trusted students was taken!
We must send someone to find the apprentice and free him before he is slain! Time is limited!
You, dear friend, have proven yourself worthy of such a quest.  I have sent word to Aegis that I will send you to aid him.
Go and gather any supplies you may need for your journey. Return here when you are ready to depart for Moonglow.
Excellent. You have returned.  I will transport you to Moonglow now.
Upon your arrival, follow the path North and you will find Moonglow.
Aegis runs a reagent shop west of the teleporter park within the Moonglow city walls.
If you have any trouble finding it, ask other adventurers around you and I am sure someone will aid you.
Good luck, young mage. I hope you succeed. May the aethers have mercy upon us if you do not.
The Archmage's face lights up as he spots you in the doorway.
Thank the heavens! Uzeraan said he would send someone, but I did not expect you so soon.
As I am sure Uzeraan has told you, one of my apprentices was abducted.
’Tis a bad omen, as this was one of the few apprentices who knew of my new spell formulas.
No doubt the mysterious dark force is behind the abduction of my most valuable student.
I must ask you to go after the evil undead that abducted my apprentice and return him to safety.
In their haste to escape, one of the abductors dropped a marked runa.
No doubt it leads to the place where they are holding my young wizard captive.
I have the rune right here. No?  Maybe in this pocket? No. Well - this is most embarrassing.
Go and fetch yourself some supplies for the forthcoming battle and I will continue my search for the rune.
Unfortunately, I have not been able to recover the rune yet. Please return in a few minutes. I will keep looking.
My ancestors smile upon me. I have found the rune to the prison camp.  With this rune we can find the lost apprentice.
I will transport you now to the location that was inscribed on this rune. I pray it takes you to my student wizard.
Slay his captors and release him from his bondage. Take these scrolls with you - they will help.
They are scrolls with the 'Unlock' spell inscribed upon them.  This spell can be very useful.
Remember however, that the Unlock spell only unlocks things that were locked using the 'Magic Lock' spell.
Also keep in mind that not only doors can be locked with the lock spell, but also containers of all sorts.
Now go. Time is short!  Return here when you have saved my apprentice.
Quest Complete! You have saved the apprentice.  Return to Aegis and speak with him.
Aegis smiles at you with a look of great satisfaction.
Well done young Mage!!!  Stay on the path of virtue and continue your lessons in the arcane arts.
I foresee that you will become a mighty spell wielder who will gain many honors throughout Britannia.
I thank you for saving my apprentice and therein saving our cause. I feel a reward is in order.
Gold is also always welcome I think, so here is a check for 1000 gold. Don't squander it now, ye hear?
Take this magical wizard's hat. It tends to be rough on the body, but does wonders for the mind.
I hope we meet again in the future my friend. I am indebted to you always.
Find Uzeraan.  Uzeraan will explain what you need to do next.
Go forth and kill at least 6 of these 'Shadow Wisps'. See if you can find any evidence of our missing men.
Return to Uzeraan and tell him of your findings.
Find 75 Mandrake roots and return them to Uzeraan. Try checking the local reagent shops.
Gather supplies for battle and return to Uzeraan when you are ready.
Venture into the mining cave and slay 6 of the restless souls. Use the teleporter in the cave to return.
Find the teleporter in the cave and return to Uzeraan.
Gather any supplies you need and return to Uzeraan when you are ready to leave for Moonglow.
Find Aegis the Archmage in the city of Moonglow. His shop is west of the teleporter park.
Explore the town and gather supplies for battle. Return to Aegis when you are ready.
Check in with Aegis after a while to see if he has recovered the rune to the prison camp.
Find the prison camp where the abducted apprentice is being held. Slay his oppressors and free him.
Return to Aegis and tell him you have freed his apprentice.
Uzeraan lives in his mansion within the city of Haven.  Find him and he will give you instructions on tasks he would like you to do for him.
Uzeraan explains tasks for you to become a better blacksmith.  He has requested that you find an anvil and forge.
Uzeraan says: Hello!  I am the grand Conjurer, Uzeraan.  I have a few tasks I'd like you to perform.
These tasks will help you to become a better blacksmith and make tools to aid your smithing.  The tasks are not pointless, as an army needs the weapons and armor you make.
First, I would like you to find an anvil and forge.  The anvils and forges can be found on this floor of my mansion.
Forge a ringmail tunic with your smithy hammer or tongs.  Uzeraan has more information, once you make the ringmail tunic.
At the forge and anvil, you craft the items of your blacksmithy trade.  To protect yourself, you should craft a ringmail tunic.
To use an anvil and forge, you must be standing next to them.  An anvil and forge allows you to use tongs or a hammer.
The tongs or hammer you use are in your backpack or hand. Double-clicking the tongs or hammer should bring up a menu to allow you to blacksmith.
If you are too far from the anvil and forge, you will not get the menu.  If you do not have enough ingots in your backpack for the item you want to smith, then you will not be able to make it.
Visit Uzeraan once you have made your ringmail tunic.
Uzeraan explains why you need the ringmail tunic for protection.  The mountains south of the mansion have ore to mine, but may have a critter or two that are hostile.
Uzeraan says: Now that you have made a ringmail tunic, you will need more ingots to supply yourself for future armor and weapons you make.  Ingots are made from ore that you mine off of mountains.
There are mountains to the south of my mansion.  They may be dangerous, so make sure to wear your ringmail tunic before you leave.
Once you find the mountains, you can mine them with your trusty shovel or pickaxe.
Once you have completed mining five large iron ore piles from mountains or caves, visit Uzeraan.  There are four types of ore piles, the largest pile smelts for the most ingots.

To mine ore, you will need to use your shovel or pickaxe on the mountainside or on a cave floor.  Double-clicking the shovel or pickaxe allows you to use the item.  You can then target the mountain or cave floor.

If an area is out of ore, you will need to hunt further along a mountainside or in a cave for more spots to mine at.  Simply use your digging tool on different areas of the stone until you get some ore.
Ore comes in varying sizes.  The smaller the pile, the fewer ingots it will make when it is smelted.  You will need five large piles of iron ore to smelt into the ingots you need.
Uzeraan's forge can be used to smelt ore into iron ingots.  Those ingots can be used to make tools.  Visit Uzeraan once you have completed smelting the ore.
Smelt ore in town at the forge for iron ingots.  Visit Uzeraan once you have completed smelting the ingots.
Uzeraan says: Now that you have the five piles of ore, you will need to smelt them.  The forge allows you to smelt ore.
Once you find the forge, double-click the piles of ore and target the red coals of the forge.  The ore will be smelted into ingots, if you are close enough to the forge.
When you have made the iron ingots, visit Uzeraan and he will instruct you on how to make more pickaxes.
Make two pickaxes for mining with your tinker kit.  Show Uzeraan a pickaxe by giving it to him.
Shovels and pickaxes break fairly often while mining.  This means you will need to make pickaxes with the ingots you mine up
To make a couple of pickaxes, you can use your tinker tools on your ingots.  Select the pickaxe from the tinker menu and it will be made from the ingots you selected.
You can make these pickaxes anywhere, as long as you have the ingots.  This means if you ever run out of pickaxes while mining a mountainside, you can make more pickaxes right away!
Make fifty iron ingots for the mansion.  Visit Uzeraan once you have completed making the ingots.
Uzeraan says:  Now that you know how to keep your pickaxes in good supply and how to make iron ingots, I happen to be in need of a large pile of ingots.
Please make fifty ingots and bring them to me.  I will buy them from you for five-hundred gold.

Iron ore piles are heavy.  You will need to lug piles of ore you mine back to the mansion to smelt them into iron ingots.  This may take you a few trips back and forth between the mountains and the forge.
Once you have completed the ingots, visit me for your payment.
Uzeraan describes the order deeds the armourers need in Minoc.  Find the moongate at the south-east part of town.  This moongate will take you to a location just outside of Minoc.
Uzeraan says: You have done very well.  You know how to supply yourself with iron ingots and pickaxes.
Now, I have a more advanced task for you.  The city armourers of Minoc are in need of weapons and armor.  I have placed their order deeds in your backpack for you to fulfill.
To get to the city of Minoc, you will need to travel through the moongate.  The moongate is located to the south-east of town, towards the mountains.
The moongate allows you to travel to far destinations.  Select Trammel and then Minoc and accept the menu and it will whisk you away.  Once there, walk west towards the road.
Now that you have found the moongate, you should walk into it.  A menu will appear asking where you wish to travel to.
There are two types of moongates.  Moongates, such as the one you just found, are scattered through the world and offer menus of different locations.
The other type of moongate does not offer a menu.  It is a moongate that powerful mages may temporarily create to allow themselves and others to pass through them to marked locations.
If you cannot walk into the moongate, you may double-click it to use it.  If you are too far from the moongate, you cannot use the moongate.
Besides allowing you to travel between locations, you may use a moongate to go to another facet.  The two facets are Felucca and Trammel.
The city of Haven is in Trammel.  If you wish to travel back to Haven, you would need to select Trammel before selecting it as the city you wish to visit.
To visit Minoc, you may visit it in either Trammel or Felucca.  Although, the armourers that need the weapons and armor are in Trammel.
Select Trammel as the facet you wish to visit and then select Minoc as the city.
The city of Minoc is a city of miners, tinkerers, and jewelers.  Minoc is to the north-northwest.  The mountains are north-east of Minoc.  You need to complete the order deeds in Minoc.
Minoc is to the north-west of the gate you have just exited from.  There is a road to the west that leads north into town.
The armourers have two shops in town.  They both have forges and anvils in them that you can use to make the weapons and armor in your order deeds.
If you pass through town, the mountains are to the north-east of Minoc.  You can use those mountains to mine the ore you need for ingots and blacksmithing.

The grey order deeds can be double-clicked to open them up and read what the amount and type of items are needed by the armourers.  Forge the items as you did for the ringmail tunic earlier with your blacksmithy hammer.

Use the combine button in the opened deed window to combine your finished products with the deed.  When you have finished the amount the orders are for, drag the deed onto an armourer or blacksmith in Minoc.
After the deeds have all been completed, travel through the moongate to Haven and find Uzeraan.
Once you have completed the deeds, Uzeraan will grant you a reward.
Uzeraan says: Congratulations!  I got word through magical means that you had completed your task.  The armourers were extremely happy to have received their orders fulfilled.
You have requested to cancel your quest.  Once you have cancelled your quest, you cannot start the young player quest again.  Do you wish to cancel your quest?
Now I can finally return to my family.  Will you go and tell Aegis that I am free and that I did not give away the secret of the new spell.
I have some unfinished business before I can return home.  Fare thee well kind adventurer.
Be sure to take your spellbook and I would also suggest that you have at least 35 of each reagent.
Be sure to take your spellbook and I would also suggest that you have at least 50 of each reagent.
We believe the vile 'Headless' are responsible for these disappearances.
Go forth and kill at least 6 of these 'Headless' creatures. See if you can find any evidence of our missing men.
Well done! You have completed your task of slaying the 'Headless'.
You however, have shown great valor in your battle against the 'Headless'!
Well there is *ONE* way - Yes! That is it. Whilst I was installing the teleporter I marked a runa in the cave!
I can use this runa to transport you directly into the caverns. Alas, you must find your own way out.
Go and gather supplies for battle. I suggest you take your weapon, some armor and at least 25 bandages to be safe.
Return here when you are ready to depart and I will transport you into the caverns below the island.
It's a treasure map I received from a dragon tamer a long time ago. I have neither the time nor the cierpliwosc to find the treasure.
Take the treasure map and this shovel.  Double click the treasure map, located in your pack, to see where the treasure is. X marks the spot.
I can teleport you close to where the treasure should be buried
I'm sorry but it seems your backpack is too full to accept your reward. Come back when you have room for it.
To show me a pickaxe you have made, drag the pickaxe onto me and I will review your crafted pickaxe.
Through my magic, I was able to raise your blacksmithy skill a couple of points.
You need to clear some space in your backpack to continue with the quest.  Visit Uzeraan when you have more space in your backpack.
The treasure should be here on this island somewhere. I've also given you an enchanted sextant that will help you find your way.
You're standing right on top of the spot!
Press ALT-R to bring up your overhead map.  Then you can double click the enchanted sextant to tell you the way.
Take heed though, the magic of the sextant will only work for you. Don't give it away!
Once you have found the spot, you will need to follow these steps to bring up the treasure:
3. Target the spot on the ground where the treasure is buried
If you are digging in the right spot, the chest will emerge, and the treasure's guardians will emerge.
You must slay all of the guardians before you can open the treasure chest.  Return here after you have completed the treasure hunt.
You have done well against the guardians of the treasure!  I feel I can entrust you with yet another quest.
We once used one of the caves below the island for mining purposes.
Return here when you are ready to depart for Moonglow.
Good luck, young fighter! I hope you succeed!  May the aethers have mercy on us if you do not.
Gather your weapon, armor and I suggest at least 30 bandages before you return.
Come back here after you have made the necessary arrangements and I will teleport you - providing I find the blasted rune.
Slay his captors and free him!  May your road to glory be paved with the blood of our oppressors.  Go now.
Well done young fighter! Stay on the path of virtue and glory and honor will be yours.
I foresee that you will become a mighty warrior.  I see fortune and glory on your path!
Take this magical sword.  It is a mighty fine weapon.  It will serve you well in your conquest against evil.
Go forth and kill at least 6 of the 'Headless' creatures. See if you can find evidence of our missing men.
Find and dig up the treasure.  Slay the guardians and take the booty that is rightfully yours.
Quest Complete!  You have found the treasure and have slain the guardians. Return to Uzeraan.
You have excavated the treasure. Return to Uzeraan.
I've given you a bag with some black, night sight potions. Drink them to see in the dark.  I've also included a few heal potions.
I have placed some bandages and heal potions in your pack, compliments of the villagers.
Czy na pewno chcesz uwolnic swego podopiecznego?
Aby kontynuowac zadanie, musisz zwolnic troche miejsca w ekwipunku. Wroc tutaj, gdy bedziesz miec wiecej miejsca w ekwipunku.
That's not enough my friend.  I need 75.  No less.
I can unfortunately not travel with you, but I have something that will help you find your way.
Take this enchanted sextant to help guide you on your journey back. Double click the sextant to show you the way to the nearest Moongate.
Once you find a Moongate, step into it and choose Moonglow as your destination.
The sextant refuses to be picked up by you
What misfortunes have befallen you that you would return without completing your task?
I have adjusted the magical teleporter to take you back.  Step onto the teleporter when you are ready.
Unfortunately, evil mages have relocated the prisoner to another camp.  Aegis has information on their whereabouts.
Seek out Aegis in Moonglow and see if he can transport you to the new location of his captured apprentice.
I have made the necessary adjustments to the Teleporter here. Step on to it when you are ready to depart.
On your way out, be sure to take a look at the 'Shadow Wisp' in the cage near the water fountain.
However, be sure to not attack the monsters in the cage as they are currently under the protection of the town guards.
You can find out if a creature is attackable or not by the color of their name when you look at them (single click).
If the name is in blue, then you may not attack them without becoming a criminal.
Needless to say, becoming a criminal in town will most certainly be detrimental to your health.
The monsters that you will encounter outside of this mansion, however will highlight grey, which means you can freely attack them.
Now please go. Time is short, dear friend.
On your way out, be sure to take a look at the 'Headless' in the cage near the water fountain
Please also note the blacksmith standing next to the magic teleporter. He sells armor and weapons.
It may be wise to purchase some equipment from him.  I would suggest armor made of ringmail and perhaps a shield.
Don't spend all your money on armor though, as you will no doubt at some time wish to purchase bolts of cloth for bandages.
Cloth can be purchased from tailors and can be cut up with scissors to create bandages.
Use bandages on yourself (double click bandages and target yourself) any time your hit points get too low.
Bandages are very cost-effective. Of course, you could also drink a healing potion (yellow) to heal your damage.
Potions, however, can be costly and require a free hand to drink.  Purchasing any of these items is easy.
Simply walk up to the appropriate vendor and say the words 'Vendor Buy', or use the vendor's context menu.
Jako duch nie mozesz wchodzic w interakcje ze swiatem. Nie mozesz dotykac przedmiotow ani ich uzywac.
Mozesz przechodzic przez drzwi, jakby nie istnialy. Jednak nie mozesz przechodzic przez sciany.
Nikt nie zrozumie, co mowisz, gdy jestes martwy, chyba ze uzywaja umiejetnosci 'Rozmowa z Duchami', aby zrozumiec twoje slowa.
Poniewaz jestes nowym graczem, wszystkie przedmioty, ktore miales przy sobie w momencie smierci, beda w twoim plecaku po wskrzeszeniu.
Aby zostac wskrzeszonym, musisz znalezc uzdrowiciela w miescie lub wedrujacego po dziczy. Niektorzy potezni gracze moga rowniez byc w stanie cie wskrzesic.
Dopoki jestes w statusie mlodego gracza, po smierci zostaniesz przeniesiony do najblizszego uzdrowiciela (razem z twoimi przedmiotami).
Aby powrocic do swiata zywych, po prostu podejdz do jednego z uzdrowicieli NPC, a oni cie wskrzesza, o ile nie jestes oznaczony jako przestepca.
You may not loot this mongbat. Find the one that took your gold.
This mongbat does not have your gold. You need to find the mongbat that highlights grey.
No one is allowed to enter this cave from here.
This yellow potion needs to be in your backpack before you may use it.
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>Um... er... greetings. I... um... had some gold that I was supposed to give you... gold courtesy of Uzeraan, who's a mage you'll meet later.</BASEFONT></BODY>

<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>But, ya see, one of those mongbats over there took the gold from me just before you arrived. I think you'll be able to get the gold back from the creature. Don't worry, I can teach you some things you'll need to know.</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>Skip this Quest and go to Haven</BASEFONT></BODY>

<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>Great, let's begin. You'll have to attack and defeat the mongbat in order to get your gold back. One of the first things you need to do is equip a weapon... which just means you need to put it into your hand.</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>First, you need to open your paperdoll and your inventory. We're going to equip your weapon
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>How do I open my paperdoll?</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#FF0000>How do I open my paperdoll?</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>How do I open my inventory?</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#FF0000>How do I open my inventory?</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>To open your paperdoll, single left click your character and select <BASEFONT COLOR=#FFFFFF>Open Paperdoll<BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>.</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>How do I equip a weapon?</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#FF0000>How do I equip a weapon?</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>How do I take things from the corpse?</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#FF0000>How do I take things from the corpse?</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>To open your inventory, single left click your character and select <BASEFONT COLOR=#FFFFFF>Open Backpack<BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>.</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>Next, you'll need to know how to move around.</BASEFONT></BODY>

<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>To walk or run, click and hold your right mouse button on the screen in the direction you wish to move, and you will move toward the cursor. When the cursor is close to you, you will walk. When the cursor is further away, towards the edge of the screen, you will run.</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>Alright, now it's time to attack the mongbat that took your gold.</BASEFONT></BODY>

<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>To attack someone or something, you double left click them while in War Mode. You only need to double left click them one time, though for most weapons you'll need to be standing directly next to your target in order to swing at them.</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>How do I switch to War Mode?</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#FF0000>How do I switch to War Mode?</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>How do I know which mongbat to attack?</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#FF0000>How do I know which mongbat to attack?</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>Right... good question: How do you switch to War Mode?</BASEFONT></BODY>

<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>No problem. You switch between War and Peace modes by left clicking the Peace or War button on your paperdoll. You may also use the keyboard shortcut, ALT-C.</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>When in War Mode, you will take a combat stance and the button on your paperdoll will say, 'War' and will turn red.</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>Important: Don't double left click anyone or anything while in War mode unless you want to attack them!</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>How do I attack the mongbat?</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#FF0000>How do I attack the mongbat?</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>Another good question: How do I know which mongbat to attack?</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>The mongbat that highlights grey is the one you should attack. Any mongbats that highlight blue should be left alone.</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>Highlighting means that while in War mode, when the cursor is over a target creature, that creature is given a highlight color over its entire body.</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>When you're ready, find the mongbat that highlights grey and attack it.</BASEFONT></BODY>

<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>Now that the mongbat is dead, its corpse has fallen to the ground at your feet. Double left click the corpse to reveal what the mongbat had been carrying.</BASEFONT></BODY>

<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>The pile of gold is your gold that was stolen. And wow! A Greater Heal potion... cool! If you use a Greater Heal potion, it will heal damage taken during combat.</BASEFONT></BODY>

<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>To take these items, click and hold your left mouse button on one of them, drag it into your open backpack, and then release your left mouse button. Take both items this way.</BASEFONT></BODY>

<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>To leave this area. take the stairs in the corner to the central chamber. Then ascend up the stairs in the middle of that chamber. This will take you to the city of Haven where you'll meet Uzeraan. He'll be waiting to speak with you.</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>Oh, and... I beg of you... please don't tell Uzeraan I lost your gold. Please!!</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>Equip your weapon whenever you're ready.</BASEFONT></BODY>

If you are leaving the mansion, you should learn about the Radar Map.
The Radar Map (or Overhead View) can be opened by pressing 'ALT-R' on your keyboard. It shows your immediate surroundings from a bird's eye view.
Pressing ALT-R twice, will enlarge the Radar Map a little.  The map shows you your immediate surroundings from a bird's eye view.
You can close the map by right clicking on it.  Use the Radar Map often as you travel throughout the world to familiarize yourself with your surroundings.
Why are you giving me this?  You need to make pickaxes!
You have not made two pickaxes.  Come back and show me your work when you have both completed.
Remember that context menus can be called up by single left clicking something (or shift-left click if you have changed the option).
After you have indicated to the vendor that you wish to purchase something, you will be shown a list of the goods they have to offer.
Speaking of context menus, you can bring up the status of your quest by bringing up your avatar's own context menu (single left, or shift-left click yourself).
Choose the 'Quest Log' option, and any information pertinent to your current quest status will be shown to you.
To help you find the location of the treasure, you should become familiar with the Radar Map.
The teleporter to the caves is against the north wall of this room.
May good luck and fortune guide your way.
Once you emerge from the Moongate, the city will be roughly to the north.  It should not be difficult to find.  Find Aegis and speak with him once you are in the city..
Actually, before you can spend this money, you will have to take the check to a bank and cash it.
NPC shop keepers do not accept checks as payment.  Checks are a handy way to transport large sums of money without having to lug all that gold around.
Cashing a check is very easy.  All you have to do is locate a NPC Banker or Minter, walk near them and say the word 'Bank'.
Place the check into your bank box and double click it to cash it.  Bankers and Minters can be found inside of banks across the world.
There is a bank not too far from here, Southeast of this shop, actually.  Banks are often crowded with people conducting business.
Go now to cash your check.  The person cashing your check will explain the details of Britannia's banking system to you.
Ah! Thank you noble adventurer!  I have accepted your check and cashed it for you.  The cash can be found in your bank box.
To open your bank box, you must be near a Banker or Minter and say the word 'Bank'.
Of course you can also open your bank box by using a Minter's or Banker's context menu.
Bank boxes in Britannia are special in that the goods you place in to a bank box anywhere, can be accessed from your bank box anywhere else in the land.
That is to say, your bank box, along with any goods you placed into it,  is accessible from any bank in the land.
The safest place for any of your goods, is your bank box.  No one can access it except for you.
That's pretty much all there is to banking.  I bet you are eager to explore the world, so I won't hold you up any longer.
I've no tasks for you to complete, and you are free to adventure in the world on your own.
May your bank box overflow with the spoils of your adventures.  We shall no doubt see each other again.
Locate the bank and find the NPC Banker (or Minter) inside.  Then, say the word 'Bank' and place your check into your bank box and double click it.
To make it easier to find the Treasure, be sure to use your radar map.
To make your attack, you will most likely wish to use your magical powers, so allow me to give you a brief explanation of magic.
Most often, spells start out as scrolls written by either NPC or Player scribes.  Once a spell has been successfully scribed, you have two choices:
One: You can cast the spell by using (double click) the scroll.  No spell reagents (ingredients) are required to cast spells from scrolls. Casting from a scroll consumes the scroll.
Two: You can drop the scroll on to your spellbook where it will be permanently written.  You can then cast the spell from your spellbook any time you wish.
To cast a spell from a spellbook, the necessary reagents are required (listed with the spell in your spellbook).
Casting spells from a spellbook AND casting spells from scrolls requires a certain amount of mana. The actual amount of mana required differs from circle to circle.
The 1st circle of spells is the easiest of spells to cast (and also has the least mana requirement) whilst 8th circle spells are difficult even for a Grandmaster Mage.
To actually cast a spell from your spellbook, you must first open your spellbook (double click).  This opens the book to the 1st & 2nd circle spells.
You can turn pages by single clicking the corner in the top right hand side of the spellbook, or you can single click on the circled numbers on the bottom to jump to specific circle.
You can double click any of the spell names to make an attempt at casting that spell.  To see a spell's reagent requirements, single click on the spell name.
Single clicking on a spell name will give you all the details of the spell.  You can see the aforementioned reagent requirements as well as the spell's icon.
Another way of casting a spell is to click on that spell's spell icon.  You can drag any spell's icon off of the book and place it anywhere in the game window.
Once a spell icon is in the game window, it will stay there even if you close the spellbook.  This is an easy way to set up many spells for quick casting.
Before going into battle, you should always check your reagent supply and make sure you have your spell icons set up.
You now have enough Mandrake in your pack to complete your task for Uzeraan.  Find Uzeraan and give him 75 mandrake roots by dragging them onto him.
You have enough Mandrake in your pack to complete your task for Uzeraan.  Find Uzeraan and give him 75 mandrake roots by dragging them onto him.
I have drawn you a picture of what the Reagent Shop sign looks like (left).   Remember that you can also look at (single click) shop signs to read them.
Marking runes is easy.  I'll give you a quick explanation of how it works, then I would advise that you mark a rune somewhere around my mansion so you can return quickly.
To mark a rune, you must stand in the place where you wish to appear when casting the 'Recall' or 'Gate' spell.
Then you cast the mark spell (either from a scroll or your spellbook, as I have explained earlier).  Once the spell is cast you will get a targeting cursor.
Target the rune you wish to mark and single click it.  If your spell is successful, the rune will sparkle and will from then on be 'marked'.
Looking at the rune (single click) will give you the description of the rune.  If you wish to change the default description, simply double click the rune.
Once you have double clicked the rune, you will get a text prompt.  Enter the new description and press the [enter] key on your keyboard.
By naming all of your runes to something that is meaningful to you, you can keep your rune library organized and easy to use.
During combat it is important to keep an eye on your hit points.  Should they ever drop below 0, you will die.
To bring up your status bar, single click yourself and drag away from your avatar.  Double click the status bar to see details.
If your health drops too low, you should heal yourself with bandages or healing potions.  Heal yourself often, and you should have no trouble surviving.
One more thing before you depart for battle:
You have found a Moongate.  Remember to choose 'Moonglow' as your destination when you step into the gate.
Moonglow is where Aegis is waiting for you in his shop.
Congratulations! You've completed all of your quests!
I can open a Moongate for you from here to an area close to the Moongate that can take you to the city of Moonglow.
I only have runes marked for near the Moongate, but the sextant will help you find the rest of the way.
I have drawn you a picture to the left of what the sign on Aegis' Shop looks like. It should help you find it a little easier.
You do not have enough reagents to safely go on.  You should acquire at least 35 of each reagent.
There are 8 types of reagent: Mandrake, Nightshade, Black Pearl, Sulfurous Ash, Spider's Silk, Garlic, Ginseng and Bloodmoss.
The caves tend to be dark, so be sure to cast the 'Night Sight' spell on yourself if you have trouble seeing.
That is not a valid target.
You can only trap things you are carrying.
Use a mapmaker's pen to draw maps.
To jest teraz mapa skarbow poziomu pierwszego.
Tylko mlody gracz moze uzyc tej mapy skarbow.
Zanim otworzysz skrzynie, musisz zabic jej straznikow.

Double click the grey order deeds to open them.  Once open, the deed lists which items and what quantity the armourer needs.  Once you forge an item, combine the item with the deed by choosing ‘Combine Item’ and targeting the item.
Uzeraan explains the bank is on the north side of town.  Take your bank check to a banker and drop it on the banker to cash it in.
Uzeraan says: Congratulations!  I got word through magical means that you had completed your task.  The armourers were extremely happy to have received their orders fulfilled.

Through my magic, I was able to raise your blacksmithy skill a couple points.  Now, I would like to let you take some time to put your goods in the bank. The bank is right next to the mansion to the southeast.
As you approach the bank, the names of bankers and their titles of 'banker' or 'minter' will appear.  This means you have located the building where you can access your bank account.
How to open your bank account by saying the word 'bank' and depositing items.  Once finished, visit Uzeraan and he will give you a pack horse.
Ah! Thank you noble adventurer!  I have accepted your check and cashed it for you.  The cash can be found in your bank box.
Of course you can also open your bank box by using a Minter's or Banker's context menu.
Bank boxes in Britannia are special in that the goods you place into a bank box anywhere can be accessed from your bank box anywhere else in the land.
The safest place for any of your goods is your bank box.  No one can access your bank box except for you.
After you have finished depositing items in your bank, visit Uzeraan for a pack horse.
Uzeraan explains how to use a pack horse.  Take your pack horse to mountains south of Uzeraan's castle.
Pack horses are used to carry large quantities of items that you normally could not fit in your backpack.  Miners use them for carrying large quantities of ore, ingots, and some tools.
Pack horses are loyal to their masters unless they are not fed.  Apples or pears are foods that the pack horses appreciate and will keep them loyal.
Once you have renamed your pack horse, you can have your pet obey commands.  The most common commands are 'follow me' and 'stay'.  However, your pet must be in range to hear you.
All pets you own can be renamed.  Click and hold the left mouse button on the pack horse and drag its health bar.
Try walking away from your pack horse and tell it to follow you by left-clicking on the pack horse and select the command 'follow'.
To get your pet to stay, you would tell it to stay by left-clicking on the pack horse and select the command 'stay' from the command list.
Mine 40 piles of ore from the mountains and use your pack horse to haul the piles of ore.  Visit Uzeraan at his mansion once you have the 40 piles of ore.
Now that you know how to handle your pack horse, use your new pack horse to haul 40 large piles of ore from the mountains.  You will need to tinker a couple more shovels to be able to mine the ore.
You can double-click on your pack horse to open its backpack.  While open, you can load your pack horse by dropping items into its backpack.
Uzeraan encourages you to practice to 70 skill in blacksmithy.  You do not have to train immediately.  When you have reached 70 skill, visit Uzeraan.
Uzeraan says: Congratulations!  You have mastered the basics of mining and blacksmithy.  I am giving you 500 gold for your ore.  You may keep your pack horse.

Now that you have accomplished so much, you should train your blacksmithy skill so you may perform a more difficult task.  It may take some time to train to 70 skill.  I have a task to ask of you when you have finished training.
You do not need to hurry out and train.  The world is waiting to be explored and some adventurers may need your skills.  Come visit me when you have trained to 70 skill (or higher).

Now that you are an accomplished blacksmith, Uzeraan has another set of orders the armourers of Minoc would like you to fulfill.  Once completed, give them to an armourer or blacksmith in the city of Minoc.
Uzeraan says: Ah, I see that you are well on your way to mastering blacksmithy.  I have four order deeds that the armourers would like you to fulfill in Minoc.
One of the deeds is the large order, which must be combined to completed order deeds.  The three smaller deeds are for chainmail.
Combine the items requested in the order with the small deed.  Once the deed is completed, you can use the large order deed to combine with a smaller deed.
The large order deed, when it is filled with all of the small deeds, would then be dropped onto an armourer or blacksmith in Minoc.  They will make sure your goods go to those in need.
Visit Uzeraan once you have completed the orders for the armourers of Minoc.
Now that you have helped the blacksmiths of Minoc, you have proved your worthiness of mastering blacksmithy.
When you have reached 100 skill in blacksmithy, you will have the ability to mark your crafted items with your name.
Folk from around the world of Britannia can wear your signed armor and wield your signature weapons when you are a grandmaster blacksmith.
You have just slain your first 'Headless'. Now is a good time to check your health and heal yourself, if need be.
To check your health, single left-click + drag away from your avatar. This brings up your status bar.
Double click the status bar to see detailed information. Check your hitpoints and determine if you would like to heal yourself at this point or not.
To heal yourself you may use bandages (double click bandages and target yourself) or drink a heal potion (free one of your hands and double click the potion).
Alternatively, if you know your way around spellbooks and such, you can cast the Heal or Greater Heal spells to recover lost hitpoints.
You have slain the leader of the pack.
Be sure to check his corpse (double click) for the red box which holds the key to the cage in which the apprentice is being held.
Cast the Unlock spell on the red box to open the lock.
Open (double click) the red box and find the key inside. Take the key (drag and drop into your pack).
Use the key (double click) and target the door on the prison cage. This will unlock the door.
Now you can open the door (double click) to free the apprentice.
You have just slain your first 'Shadow Wisp'. Now is a good time to check your health and heal yourself if need be.
You should have a bank check in your backpack (a yellow check).  Speak the word 'bank' to open your bank box, drag your bank check into the box, and double-click it to cash it in.
Visit Uzeraan after you have loaded 40 large piles of ore onto your pack horse.
To feed your pack horse, you would drag one apple or pear onto your pack horse.  A good practice is to feed your pack horse once an hour.
Click on the name on the health bar, delete its current name and type in a new name like 'Ed' or 'Trigger' (without spaces in the name).
The pack horse should whinny and walk towards you (unless it is not well fed), after you target yourself with the target cursor.
If the list has not ever displayed, try holding the shift key and left-clicking on the pack horse.  Take your pack horse south to the mountains to receive further instructions.
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>First, you need to open your paperdoll and your inventory. We're going to put your sword - a katana - in your hand
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>First, you need to open your paperdoll and your inventory. We're going to put your smith's hammer in your hand

<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>Even though you don't need to have your spellbook in your hand to cast a spell, it looks cool *grin*! To put your spellbook in your hand, you click and hold your left mouse button on the spellbook, drag the spellbook onto your paperdoll, and then release the mouse button.</BASEFONT></BODY>

<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>You're going to cast Magic Arrow on the mongbat. Open your spellbook by double left clicking it. On the first page, titled First Circle, you'll see the words <BASEFONT COLOR=#FFFFFF>Magic Arrow<BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>.</BASEFONT></BODY>

<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>To cast this spell, you'll double click the words, <BASEFONT COLOR=#FFFFFF>Magic Arrow<BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>, in your spellbook, and then left click on the mongbat with the targeting cursor. Repeat this until you've defeated the mongbat.</BASEFONT></BODY>
<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>Another good question: How do I know which mongbat to cast the spell on?</BASEFONT></BODY>

<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>Highlighting means that when you are casting a spell and are passing the cursor over a creature to target it,  that creature is given a highlight color over its entire body.</BASEFONT></BODY>

<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>Be sure to exit War mode when you are finished with your attack. This is done by left clicking the red War button on your paperdoll. You may also use the keyboard shortcut, ALT-C, to toggle between War and Peace modes.</BASEFONT></BODY>

<BODY><BASEFONT COLOR=#DFDFC0>Great, let's begin. You'll have to attack and defeat the mongbat in order to get your gold back. The first thing we'll do is equip your spellbook... which just means you'll put it in your hand.</BASEFONT></BODY>

You sense that there are Horde Minions lurking about this area...
A sense of tranquility overcomes you as you leave the Horde Minions' domain...

Uzeraan greets you as you approach...

Greetings traveler!

I am Uzeraan, the lord of this house and overseer of this fine city, Haven. I know we have just met, but time is short and we need to reinforce the troops in the mountain pass, so I will not waste your time with pleasantries.

We have been trying to fight back the wicked Horde Minions which have recently begun attacking our cities - but to no avail. We desperately need help!

Your first task will be to assess the situation in the mountain pass, and help our troops defeat the Horde Minions there.

Take the road marked with glowing runes, that starts just outside of this mansion. Before you go into battle, it would be prudent to review combat techniques as well as information on healing yourself.

To aid you in your fight, you may also wish to purchase equipment from Frank the Blacksmith, who is standing just South of here.

Good luck young warrior.

Find the mountain pass beyond the house which lies at the end of the runic road.

Assist the city Militia by slaying Horde Minions

It's no use... The Horde Minions are too many. They are appearing out of nowhere.

Return to Uzeraan and report your findings.

Important Quest Information

During your quest, any important information that a NPC gives you, will appear in a window such as this one. You can review the information at any time during your quest.

Getting Help

Some of the text you will come across during your quest, will be underlined links to the codex of wisdom, or online help system. You can click on the text to get detailed information on the underlined subject. You may also access the Codex Of Wisdom by pressing "F1" or by clicking on the "?" on the toolbar at the top of your screen.

Context Menus

Context menus can be called up by single left-clicking (or Shift + single left-click, if you changed it) on most objects or NPCs in the world. Nearly everything, including your own avatar will have context menus available. Bringing up your avatar's context menu will give you options to cancel your quest and review various quest information.

In case you change your mind later...

You may re-start this quest at any time while you are still considered (young). Simply return to Uzeraan's mansion and speak with any of the guards there.

Unfortunately, the entrance to one of our mining caves collapsed recently, trapping our miners inside.

Schmendrick went to install magical teleporters inside the mines so that the miners would have a way out. The miners have since returned, but Schmendrick has not. Those who have returned, all seem to have lost their minds to madness

Find the High Mage Schmendrick in the mines and recover the scroll of power from him.

Schmendrick barely pays you any attention as you approach him. His mind seems to be occupied with something else. You explain to him that you came for the scroll of power and after a long while he begins to speak, but apparently still not giving you his full attention...

Hmmm.. peculiar indeed. Very strange activity here indeed... I wonder...

Hmmm. Oh yes! Scroll, you say? I don't have it, sorry. My apprentice was carrying it, and he ran off to somewhere in this cave. Find him and you will find the scroll.

Be sure to bring the scroll to Uzeraan once you have it. He's the only person aside from myself who can read the ancient markings on the scroll. I need to figure out what's going on down here before I can leave. Strange activity indeed...

Schmendrick goes back to his work and you seem to completely fade from his awareness...
Find Schmendrick's apprentice who is somewhere in the mining cave.  The apprentice has the scroll of power needed by Uzeraan.

You have obtained the scroll of power! Find your way out of the cave.

Hand the scroll to Uzeraan (drag and drop) once you arrive in his mansion.

Uzeraan carefully unravels the scroll and begins to read...after a short while his face lights up with a smile and he speaks to you...

This is wonderful, friend! For your troubles I've given you a treasure map I had laying about, along with a shovel to dig up the treasure. Feel free to find the treasure at your leisure.

Now let us get back to the business of this scroll. The only trouble, is that this scroll calls for some special ingredients that I do not have on hand.

Though it may involve some danger, I will ask of you to find these reagents for me.

There are three reagents I need to complete the spell.

The first thing I need is some Fertile Dirt.

There lives a Dryad on this island who I know would have such a thing on hand. I have recalibrated the teleporter to transport you to the Dryad's grove, which lies South-West of this mansion.

Tell her Uzeraan sent you, and she should cooperate.

Should you get into trouble out there or should you lose your way, do not worry. I have also given you a magical horn - a Horn of Retreat. Play the horn at any time to open a magical gateway that leads back to this mansion.

Should your horn run out of charges, simply hand me or any of my mansion guards the horn to have it recharged.

Good luck friend.

The Dryad watches hungrily as you approach, giving you an uneasy feeling in the pit of your stomach. You explain that Uzeraan has sent you for a quantity of fertile dirt. With a wide grin and in a slightly hoarse voice she replies...

Fertile Dirt, eh? Well, I have a few patches here...but what have you brought me in return? Came empty-handed did you? That's unfortunate indeed... but since you were sent by my dear friend Uzeraan, I supposed I could oblige you.

The Dryad digs around in the ground and hands you a patch of Fertile Dirt.

With a smile she goes back to her work...

You have acquired the Fertile Dirt!

Return to the mansion (North-East of the Dryad's Grove) and hand it to Uzeraan.

Uzeraan takes the dirt from you and smiles...

Wonderful! I knew I could count on you. As a token of my appreciation I've given you a bag with some bandages as well as some healing potions. They should help out a bit.

The next item I need is a Vial of Blood. I know it seems strange, but that's what the formula asks for. I have some locked away in a chest not far from here. It's only a short distance from the mansion. Let me give you directions...

Exit the front door to the East. Then follow the path to the North. You will pass by several pedestals with lanterns on them. Continue on this path until you run into a small hut. Walk up the stairs and through the door. Inside you will find a chest. Open it and bring me a Vial of Blood from inside the chest. It's very easy to find. Just follow the road and you can't miss it.

Good luck!
You have been ambushed! Fight for your honor!!!
You take a vial of blood from the chest and put it in your pack.

You have the vial of blood!

Return to Uzeraan's mansion and hand him the vial.

You hand Uzeraan the Vial of Blood, which he hastily accepts...

Excellent work! Only one reagent remains and the spell is complete! The final requirement is a Daemon Bone, which will not be as easily acquired as the previous two components.

There is a haunted graveyard on this island, which is the home to many undead creatures. Dispose of the undead as you see fit. Be sure to search their remains after you have smitten them, to check for a Daemon Bone. I'm quite sure that you will find what we seek, if you are thorough enough with your extermination.

Take this magical silver sword to aid you in your battle. Silver weapons will damage the undead twice as much as your regular weapon.

Return here when you have found a Daemon Bone.
Head East of here (or use the Horn of Retreat) to return to Uzeraan's Mansion and deliver the bone to Uzeraan.

As you hand Uzeraan the final reagent, he nods at you with approval and starts searching through the pockets of his robe...

After a short while he hands you a small pouch...

There you are. Your contract of employment with me has expired and so here is your pay. 2000 gold in the form of a check and a magical sextant that will help you find Moongates and Banks.

Before you can actually spend the money I have given you, however, you must cash the check.

I have recalibrated the teleporter to take you to the Haven Bank. Step onto the teleporter to be taken to the bank, which lies South-East of here.

Thank you for all your help friend. I hope we shall meet each other again in the future.

Farewell.
Locate the Haven Bank (use the teleporter in Uzeraan's Mansion if necessary), which lies South-East of Uzeraan's Mansion. Once there, cash your check.

The banker smiles at you and greets you in a loud and robust voice...

Well hello there adventurer! I see you've learned how to cash checks. Wonderful! Let me tell you a bit about the banks in this world...

Anything that you place into any bank box, can be retrieved from any other bank box in the land. For instance, if you place an item into a bank box in Haven, it can be retrieved from your bank box in Britain or any other city.

Bank boxes are very secure. So secure, in fact, that no one can ever get into your bank box except for yourself. Security is hard to come by these days, but you can trust in the banking system of Britannia! We shall not let you down!

I hope to be seeing much more of you as your riches grow! May your bank box overflow with the spoils of your adventures.

Farewell adventurer, you are now free to explore the world on your own.

Return the scroll to me and I will try to make another scroll for you.

The City of Haven is a city that was created especially with young players in mind.

Haven is located on a small island, so even if you get lost in the adventuring areas surrounding Haven, you're never too far from town.

Goods are less expensive in Haven, compared to other cities, and the aforementioned adventuring areas are tailored specifically to the young adventurer's needs.

You are currently reading the Codex of Wisdom, or "Online Help System". Clicking the "?" on the toolbar which is located at the top of your screen, or pressing "F1" on your keyboard will bring up this Codex of Wisdom.

You will find help with many general as well as specific game player issues listed in the help topics. Clicking on hyperlinks (underlined, blue text) within the codex, will automatically take you to the appropriate Codex entry.

Potions can be purchased from Alchemist Shopkeepers and Vendors.

Potions are available in various colors (determines the effect) and strengths. To consume a potion, simply drink it (double click), which empties the potion and leaves you with an empty bottle.

Most potions can be found as loot on creatures, and are sold by NPC Alchemist Shopkeepers and are usually craftable by player Alchemists.

Keep in mind, however, that NPC shop keepers will most likely not carry the stronger versions of a given potion. You will more often than not need to seek a player Alchemist to find the most powerful potions.

The potions currently available are as follows:

* Night Sight
* Leczenie
* Strength
* Refresh
* Explosion
* Cure
* Agility

Opis:

Wypicie tej mikstury pozwala na widzenie w ciemnosciach. wyjatkowo przydatne w podziemiach!

Mikstura dostepna tylko w jednym stezeniu.

Ta mikstura dostepna jest u Sprzedawcow miejskich, a takze wykonywana przez gracza Alchemika. Jedynym skladnikiem wymaganym do wytworzenia mikstury jest Pajeczyna.

Mikstura dostepna pod postacia Malej mikstury leczenia, Mikstury leczenia i Duzej mikstury leczenia.

Summary:

Drinking this potion immediately poisons you and begins to drain your health. Depending on the strenght of the poison, you may or may not survive, unless an appropriate cure is administered in a timely fashion. The cure can come in the form of a cure potion or a cure spell cast by a mage.

On a more useful note, poison potions can be used by player Poisoners to poison bladed weapons, which makes them much more effective in combat.

Strengths Available:

This potion is available in Lesser Poison, Poison, Greater Poison and Deadly Poison formulas.

Availability:

This potion is available from Shopkeepers and is craftable by player Alchemists. The only reagent required to create this potion is Nightshade.

Summary:

Drinking this potion increases your strength (and hence your maximum hitpoints) by various amounts, depending on strength, for a short time.

Strengths Available:

This potion is available in Strength and Greater Strength formulas.

Availability:

This potion is available from Shopkeepers and is craftable by player Alchemists. The only reagent required to create this potion is Mandrake.

Summary:

Drinking this potion allows you to immediately recover lost stamina (hence increasing your swing rates during combat, among other things).

Strengths Available:

This potion is available in Refresh and Total Refresh formulas.

Availability:

This potion is available from Shopkeepers and is craftable by player Alchemists. The only reagent required to create this potion is Black Pearl.

Summary:

You can not drink this potion. Instead, using the potion (double click) starts a three (3) second timer and gives you a targeting cursor. Targeting a location of creature in range, will cause you to throw the explosion towards your target. Once the 3 second timer expires, the potion will explode and damage creatures in the area.

Strengths Available:

This potion is available in Lesser Explosion, Explosion and Greater Explosion formulas.

Availability:

This potion is available from Shopkeepers and is craftable by player Alchemists. The only reagent required to create this potion is Sulfurous Ash.

Summary:

Drinking this potion will attempt to cure you, if you are poisoned. Depending on the strenght of the poison, a stronger Cure formula may be necessary.

Strengths Available:

This potion is available in Lesser Cure, Cure and Greater Cure formulas.

Availability:

This potion is available from Shopkeepers and is craftable by player Alchemists. The only reagent required to create this potion is Garlic.

Summary:

Drinking this potion will, for a short time, increase your maximum dexterity (and hence will increase your swing rate potential during combat). To make the most use out of an Agility potion, be sure to follow it up with a Refresh potion to replenish your current stamina.

Strengths Available:

This potion is available in Agility and Greater Agility formulas.

Availability:

This potion is available from Shopkeepers and is craftable by player Alchemists. The only reagent required to create this potion is Bloodmoss.

Some magical items use charges to exercise their magical properties. In most cases, a single use of the item will consume one (1) charge.

Once a magical item is out of charges, it will usually cease to operate unless you can find a way of recharging it.

Checks are an easy and safe way to transport large sums of cash about without having to carry all that heavy gold on your person. As an additional bonus, bank checks are "blessed". As a drawback, checks can not be directly spent on goods that you purchase from Shopkeepers or Vendors. To spend money from a check, you must first cash it.

Cashing a check

To cash a bank check, you must first find any bank (locations available in every major city), and open your bank box. Once your bank box is open, drag and drop the check into the bank box. Once the check is inside of your bank box, simply double click the check to cash it. The cash will be automatically deposited into your bank box.

Most blessed items can normally be identified by the "[blessed]" tag that displays above the item when looking at (single clicking) it.  A blessed item can not be stolen and will stay with your avatar, even through death.  The blessed item will be located in your backpack upon resurrection.

Cursed items are the opposite of blessed items. Cursed items can be identified by the "[cursed]" tag it displays when looking at (single clicking) it.

Cursed items will always drop to your corpse when you die. While on the Felucca facet, cursed items can always be stolen.

As a final point, cursed items can never be blessed.

These scrolls, when used, will allow you to permanently raise the maximum skill value, in a given skill, beyond 100.0 (up to 120.0). They can be found for various skills and will give varied skill max bonuses (+5, +10, +15, +20). The scrolls can only be found as loot on special Champion creatures, which can be found in dungeons, and the 2nd Age adventuring areas.

Important Information:

Scrolls of Power are cursed, so be careful when transporting them.

A player who has attained at least Level One (1) in the Justice Virtue may chose to "protect" another player. This protection can take the form of anything the protector and the protectee agree upon. Either party may chose to cancel the agreement at any time, via a context menu on the protectee. Each player may only be protected by one (1) player, although a protector can protect as many persons as they chose.

How does the protector benefit from this?

When a protectee acquires a Scroll of Power, the protector will automatically also receive a Scroll of Power. The protector must be in the area to receive the scroll.

Context Menus are menus that are available by single left-clicking (or Shift + single left-click, see below) on most objects or NPCs in the world. Nearly everything, including your own avatar will have context menus available.

If an object in the world has a context menu available, it will by default appear when you single-left click something. You may change this in under "Options" (located on your paperdoll) to work only when you are holding down the "Shift" button on your keyboard.

Treasure maps are pieces of paper that will show the location of a buried treasure somewhere in the land.

To find this treasure, a few simple steps must be followed.

1. Use the context menu on the map to decode the map. Once a map is decoded, it will no longer have the word "tattered" in it's title. This is a handy thing to know if you want to find out if a map has been previously decoded or not. This is important, since only the person that decoded the map, can actually dig up the treasure.

2. Finding the treasure is a rather simple procedure on youthful treasuremaps. You will need some sort of digging device (like a shovel or a pickaxe) to unearth the treasure. Once you have secured your tools, you will need to open the map (double click) and take a look at it. Use your Radar Map to see if you can somewhat figure out where the treasure might be by comparing the drawing on the map and the picture from the the overhead Radar.

If you are having trouble making out the area, the best thing to do is to find a patch of grass or dirt (out in the woods perhaps), and start digging. Digging is easily accomplished by using the "Dig for Treasure" context menu on the map.

Once you select the digging option, target the place on the ground that you wish to dig at. If you are not at the correct spot, you will get help message telling you which direction to move in. Follow the directions and keep digging until you find the chest.

3. Once the chest has emerged, the treasure's guardians will appear. You must defeat all of the treasure's guardians before you can loot the chest.

Good luck.

The Nightsight Spell is a 1st circle spell, and can be cast by nearly everyone. The effect of the spell is such, that the person who is targeted by the spell will be able to see in the dark. This spell is especially useful in dungeons and dark woods.

The two reagents that are required for this spell, are Spider's Silk and Sulfurous Ash.

There are three (3) magic spells that can be used to transport yourself and your friends to anywhere in the world - instantaneously.

The Mark Spell

This spell is the basis for the other travels spells. It allows you mark a location that you wish to return to at a later time, using one of the other two travel spells. more...

The Recall Spell

This is the easiest of the two transport spells to cast. It allows one traveler (the person casting) to teleport to a previously marked location. more...

The Gate Spell

This spell allows the caster to open a magical gate that allows anyone that steps into it to travel to a previously marked location. more....

The Mark Spell is a sixth (6th) circle spell and requires the Black Pearl, Bloodmoss and Mandrake Root reagents.

Casting the spell will bring up a targeting cursor. Target any rune (which can be purchased from most magic shops) to mark that rune with your current location. If the spell is successful, the rune will be permanently marked. You can mark over an already marked rune, which replaces your new location with the old location.

Once a rune is marked, you can use either the Recall or the Gate spell to travel back to the marked location, instantaneously.

The Recall Spell is a fourth (4th) circle spell and requires the Black Pearl, Bloodmoss and Mandrake Root reagents.

Casting the spell will bring up a targeting cursor. Target any previously marked rune, to attempt to instantly teleport to the location at which the rune was marked. If the destination location is not blocked (someone or something isn't standing there), the spell will succeed and you will be transported. Keep in mind that this spell only transports the caster - any pets (unless they are bonded) or friends that are with you, will be left behind.

The Gate Spell is a seventh (7th) circle spell and requires the Black Pearl, Sullfurous Ash and Mandrake Root reagents.

Casting the spell will bring up a targeting cursor. Target any previously marked rune, to attempt to open a magical gate to the location at which the rune was marked. If the destination location is not blocked (someone or something isn't standing there), the spell will succeed and a temporary gate will open. The gate will remain open only for a few moments before it closes again. Anyone wishing to travel through the gate, need only to walk into the gate and they will be transported.

As long as your pets are following you, they too will be transported when they walk into a gate.

You are about to place a new house. Placing this house will condemn any and all of your other houses that you may have. All of your houses on all shards will be affected.

In addition, you will not be able to place another house or have one transferred to you for one (1) real-life week.

Once you accept these terms, these effects cannot be reversed. Re-deeding or transferring your new house will not uncondemn your other house(s) nor will the one week timer be removed.

If you are absolutely certain you wish to proceed, click the button next to OKAY below. If you do not wish to trade for this house, click CANCEL.

Having this house transferred to you will condemn any and all of your other houses that you may have. All of your houses on all shards will be affected.

In addition, you will not be able to place another house or have one transferred to you for one (1) real-life week.

Once you accept these terms, these effects can not be reversed. Re-deeding or transferring your new house will not uncondemn your house(s) nor will the one week timer be removed.

To keep a house from collapsing, it must be periodically refreshed. The actual refresh process is different, depending on the refresh type of the house. Here is a list of all the different refresh types along with information on how a house enters the given refresh state.

Condemned

A house will be condemned when the house owner either places or accepts the transfer of a new home, or if the owner's player account becomes inactive. Condemnation will affect all houses on all shards (except in the case of a transfer or newly placed house, in which case the last house that was acquired will not be condemned, but rather will enter into the Automatic refresh state. See below for details.).

Although the contents of a condemned house are still accessible as they normally would, the house cannot be refreshed. In addition to not being refreshable, the house will collapse within 2 days of being condemned. If a house entered the condemned status because the house owner's account became inactive, the house(s) may be uncondemned by the house owner, by openeing the front door. Otherwise, the house can only be uncondemned by transferring or re-deeding it.

Grandfathered

These houses will be need to be manually refreshed by the house owner, one of the co-owners or house friends. Refreshing is done by simply opening the front door.

Automatic

When an account has only one house across all shards, that house enters the Automatic refresh state. These houses will never decay, unless they enter the Condemned state for any reason. These houses will never have to be manually refreshed.

If you are leaving the mansion, you should learn about the Radar Map.

The Radar Map (or Overhead View) can be opened by pressing 'ALT-R' on your keyboard. It shows your immediate surroundings from a bird's eye view.

Pressing ALT-R twice, will enlarge the Radar Map a little. Use the Radar Map often as you travel throughout the world to familiarize yourself with your surroundings.

You have too many followers to summon your mount.
Your current and maximum number of followers.  An individual creature may count as more than one follower.

Followers are pets, hirelings, and constructs under your control. They are gained in a variety of different ways, including Animal Taming, trading, crafting, or just handing a pile of gold to an out-of-work mercenary. All players may have up to five followers. On top of this, some individual followers may count as more than one follower. For example, a dragon counts as three followers, a hireling counts as two, and a horse counts as one. This means you could have a dragon and two horses, or two mercenaries and one horse, or any combination thereof.

Note: Some powerful creatures, such as dragons, also require Animal Taming and Animal Lore to control, regardless of the number of followers you have.

Chyloth, tak? To on przewozi przez jezioro Mortis, po ktorego drugiej stronie zyje Mroczny Ojciec - skupienie calego zla, ktore mozesz zobaczyc wszedzie wokolo.

Moge pomoc ci przywolac bestie z dna otchlani, ale potrzebuje do tego 1000 kosci demona. Jesli przyjmiesz moja pomoc, bede przechowywac kosci demona do czasu, az zbierzesz caly 1000. Kiedy zbiezesz je wszystkie, przywolam dla ciebie demona, ktorego bedziesz musial zabic aby zdobyc swoja nagrode.

Zgadzasz sie?
Brawo waleczna duszo. Przywolam teraz bestie w kregu kamieni na poludniowym-wschodzie od ciebie. Miej sie na bacznosci, bestia przybiera rozne postacie. Pospiesz sie...
Jako, zes meznie wojowal z demonem, otrzymasz w nagrode zlota czaszke.
Twoj plecak jest zbyt pelen, by wepchac tam jeszcze zlota czaszke.
Podnosisz zlota czaszke i wkladasz ja do swego plecaka.  Zanies czaszke przewoznikowi na rzece Mortis, aby dostac sie na druga strone.
Znajdz 1000 kosci demona i przynies je do Viktorii.

Zgodziles sie pomoc Viktorii. Potrzebuje ona 1000 kosci demona aby przywolac Pozeracza.

Mozesz oddawac zgromadzone kosci Viktorii, a Ona bedzie je dla Ciebie przechowywac.

Kosci demona mozesz znalezc zabijajac przerazajace kreatury w lochu przeznaczenia.

Powodzenia.
Viktoria przyjela kosci, ale nie przyniosles jeszcze wystarczajacej ilosci.

Vicotra usmiecha sie lekko i mowi...

Brawo. Zebrales wszystkie kosci demona, ktore sa wymagane do przywolania pozeracza. Przywolam go i pojawi sie on w kamiennym kregu nieopodal, o tam... Jesli zgladzisz tego demona, otrzymasz nagrode w postaci zlotej czaszki.

Niech szczscie bedzie po Twej stronie - przyda Ci sie.
Kosci, ktore dales do tej pory Viktorii zostana ci zwrocone.
Wzywam ciemne moce z glebi otchlani!
Wzywam Ciebie! Pokaz sis! *wzywa zle moce*
Bestia umarla, na twoje nieszczescie, ty takze. Nie mozesz odebrac swojej nagrody bedac martwy.  Musisz stawic mu czola ponownie.
Bestia umarla. Niestey nie pokazales swojej przydatnosci w walce z Pozeraczem.  Victoria przywola kolejna bestie w kregu kamieni. Sproboj ponownie dzielny podrozniku.
Bestia polegla. Znajdz jej cialo aby odebrac swoja nagrode!
Pozeracz zostal przywolany nieopodal kamiennego kregu.  Zgladz go, a otrzymasz nagrode!
Idz smialo i zabij przywolana bestie!
Dales mi juz wystarczajaco wiele kosci aby rzucic zaklecie przywolania. Te odloz na pozniej.
Bardzo dobrze ~1_NAME~, zgadzam sie na twoja zaplate, dalej... plyn.
Ktos zaplacil juz za twoja przeprawe przez jezioro Mortis:
~1_NAME~ odrzucil twoje zaproszenie do przebycia jeziora Mortis.
~1_NAME~ przyjal twoje zaproszenie do przebycia jeziora Mortis.
Drzwi sie otwieraja i syczenie ustaje.
Twoj koniec jest bliski - czujesz jak trucizna powoduje, ze Twoje miesnie sztywnieja.
Twoje wskrzeszenia poprzez Poswiecenie resetuja sie.
Twoje cialo nie moze byc odnalezione. Moglo sie rozlozyc. Twe przedmioty do Ciebie nie wroca. Czy chcesz zostac wskrzeszonym?
