I greet thee human and divine my boon thou seek. Convey hence the object of my riddle and I shall reward thee with thy desire.

Three lives have I.
Gentle enough to soothe the skin,
Light enough to caress the sky,
Hard enough to crack rocks
What am I?
I give thee a hint then human.  The answer to my riddle must be held carefully or it cannot be contained at all.  Bring this elusive item to me in a suitable container.
*snort* ... guard-mates ... guard-herd *hoof stomp* ... defend-with-hoof-and-horn ... thirsty-drink.  *proud head-toss*
*impatient hoof stomp* ... thirsty herd ... water scent.

Ho, there human.  Why do you seek out the Huntsman?  The hunter serves the land by culling both predators and prey.  The hunter maintains the essential balance of life and does not kill for sport or glory.  If you seek my favor, human, then demonstrate you are capable of the duty.  Cull the wolves nearby.
Then begone. I have no time to waste on you, human.
The timber wolves are easily tracked, human.

*giggle*  So serious, so grim!  *tickle*  Enjoy life!  Have fun!  Laugh!  Be merry!  *giggle*  Find three of my baubles ... *giggle* I hid them! *giggles hysterically*  Hid them!  La la la!  Bring them quickly!  They are magical and will hide themselves again if you are too slow.
Magical baubles hidden, find them as you're bidden!  *giggle*
Musisz nauczyc sie receptury ze zwoju.

What's that? *alarmed gasp*  Do not speak of the Black Order so loudly, they might hear and take offense.  *whispers*  I collect the badges of their sects, if you wish to seek them out and slay them.  Bring five of each and I will reward you.

I have a task for you ... adventurer.  Will you risk all to win great renown?  The Black Order is organized into three sects, each with their own speciality.  The Dragon's Flame serves the will of the Grand Mage, the Tiger's Claw answers to the Master Thief, and the Serpent's Fang kills at the direction of the High Executioner.  Slay all three and you will strike the order a devastating blow!
We believe the Black Order has fallen under the sway of Minax, somehow.  Seek evidence that proves our theory by piercing the secrets of the Citadel.
You have discovered a bundle of stolen property.  Will you return it to its rightful owner?

The Dragon's Flame sect members have gone too far!  Express to them my displeasure by slaying ten of them.  But remember, I do not condone war on women, so I will only accept the deaths of men, human or elf.  Either race will do, I care not for the shape of their ears.  Yes, this action will properly make clear my disapproval and has a pleasing harmony.

I wish to make a statement of censure against the elite ninjas of the Black Order.  Deliver, in the strongest manner, my disdain.  But do not make war on women, even those that take arms against you.  It is not ... fitting.

The Tiger's Claw sect members have gone too far!  Express to them my displeasure by slaying ten of them.  But remember, I do not condone war on women, so I will only accept the deaths of men, human and elf.

The Serpent's Fang sect members have gone too far!  Express to them my displeasure by slaying ten of them.  But remember, I do not condone war on women, so I will only accept the deaths of men, human and elf.
You have discovered a contracted agreement of assassination.  Perhaps the individual named in the contract would pay gladly for the document?
*whisper* It's a very dangerous task.  Let me know if you change your mind.
*whisper* The Citadel entrance is disguised as a fishing village.  The magical portal into the stronghold itself is moved frequently.  You'll need to search for it.
I do not fault your decision.
Once you gain entrance into The Citadel, you will need to move cautiously to find the sect leaders.
Many fear to tangle with the wicked sorceress.  I understand and appreciate your concerns.
I don't know where inside The Citadel such evidence could be found.  Perhaps the most guarded sanctum is the place to look.
Of course, you could also choose to keep the bundle.
Examine the package for the name and location of its rightful owner.
The Black Order's fortress home is well hidden.  Legend has it that a humble fishing village disguises the magical portal.
Examine the contract for the name and location of the intended victim.

Why?  I ask you why?  They walk around after they're put in the ground.  It's just wrong in so many ways.  Put them to proper rest, I beg you.  I'll find some way to pay you for the kindness. Just kill five zombies and five skeletons.

Why?  I ask you why?  They walk around after they're put in the ground.  It's just wrong in so many ways.  Put them to proper rest, I beg you.  I'll find some way to pay you for the kindness. Just kill ten skeletal mounts.

Why?  I ask you why?  They walk around after they're put in the ground.  It's just wrong in so many ways.  Put them to proper rest, I beg you.  I'll find some way to pay you for the kindness. Just kill eight patchwork skeletons.

Why?  I ask you why?  They walk around after they're put in the ground.  It's just wrong in so many ways.  Put them to proper rest, I beg you.  I'll find some way to pay you for the kindness. Just kill twelve ghouls.
You can't trust them, you know.  Lizardmen I mean.  They have forked tongues ... and you know what that means.  Exterminate ten of them and I'll reward you.
They may not be bright, but they're incredibly destructive.  Kill off ten trolls and I'll consider it a favor done for me.

Those green-skinned freaks have run off with more of my livestock.  I want an orc scout killed for each sheep I lost and an orc for each chicken.  So that's four orc scouts and eight orcs I'll pay you to slay.
Disgusting!  The way they scuttle on those hairy legs just makes me want to gag.  I hate spiders!  Rid the world of twelve and I'll find something nice to give you in thanks.
It's a big job but you look to be just the adventurer to do it!  I'm so glad you came by ... I'm paying well for the death of five ogres and five ettins.  Hop to it, if you're so inclined.
I bet you can't kill ... say ten ... lava lizards!  I bet they're too much for you.  You may as well confess you can't ...
I bet you can't kill ... say twelve ... flesh golems! I bet they're too much for you. You may as well confess you can't ...
I bet you can't kill ... ten gore fiends! I bet they're too much for you. You may as well confess you can't ...
I bet you can't kill ... ten harpies!  I bet they're too much for you.  You may as well confess you can't ...
I bet you can't kill ... ten gibberlings!  I bet they're too much for you.  You may as well confess you can't ...
I bet you can't tangle with those nasty plants ... say eight corpsers and two swamp tentacles!  I bet they're too much for you.  You may as well confess you can't ...
I bet you can't tangle with those bloodsuckers ... say around ten vampire bats!  I bet they're too much for you.  You may as well confess you can't ...
You've got to help me out! Those wild ostards have been causing absolute havok around here.  Kill them off before they destroy my land.  There are around twelve of them.

It's a big job but you look to be just the adventurer to do it! I'm so glad you came by ... I'm paying well for the death of six giant ice serpents and six frost spiders. Hop to it, if you're so inclined.
You've got to help me out! Those dire wolves have been causing absolute havok around here. Kill them off before they destroy my land. They run around in a pack of around ten.
You've got to help me out! Those ratmen have been causing absolute havok around here. Kill them off before they destroy my land. I'll pay you if you kill off twelve of those dirty rats.

A pity really. With the balance of nature awry, we have no choice but to accept the responsibility of making it all right. It's all a part of the circle of life, after all. So, yes, the grizzly bears are running rampant. There are far too many in the region. Will you shoulder your obligations as a higher life form?

Have you ever seen what a slime can do to good gear?  Well, it's not pretty, let me tell you!  If you take on my task to destroy twelve of them, bear that in mind.  They'll corrode your equipment faster than anything.

I admire them, you know.  The solen have their place -- regimented, organized.  They're fascinating to watch with their constant strife between red and black.  I can't help but want to stir things up from time to time.  And that's where you come in.  Kill either twelve red or twelve black solen workers and let's see what happens next!

I imagine you don't know about the mongbats.  Well, you may think you do, but I know more than just about anyone.  You see they come in two varieties ... the stronger and the weaker.  Either way, they're a menace.  Exterminate ten of the weaker ones and four of the stronger and I'll pay you an honest wage.
Disgusting!  The way they scuttle on those hairy legs just makes me want to gag.  I hate spiders and anything like them!  Rid the world of twelve terathan drones and I'll reward you.
A gorilla once bit my sister.  No, really.  So, I'm on a crusade to have the filthy beasts destroyed once and for all.  Kill eight of them and I'll make it worth your while.
I bet you can't handle ten plague spawns!  I bet they're too much for you.  You may as well confess you can't ...
Welcome to the Prism of Light Cavern Exhibit.
The cavern, located deep beneath the Nujel'm Palace, was discovered by Lord Graye Denthe.
The caverns contain more than 2 dozen varieties of crystals.
Only Malas and the Prism of Light Caverns have these naturally occurring crystals.
The cavern is also known for the rich supply of gems scattered throughout the rock.
Most of the cavern is off limits to the general public because of the instability of the cavern system.
Lord Denthe disappeared after venturing into the cavern. No sign of him has been seen since.
Crystals often form in cluster-like formations in the dark recesses of the cavern.
Closed for emergency repairs. do not enter.

Wolves are known to travel in packs.
Quagmire and many other swamp creatures are made almost entirely out of plant material.
Silver Steeds are nearly extinct. The few remaining steeds are living mythical creatures.
The Sphynx is a highly intelligent and dangerous creature.
Reptalons are fierce, but can be trained by patient expert tamers.
Drakes belong to the dragon family. When angered they snort fire at enemies.
Wyverns have scorpion-like stingers that inject toxic poison into their victims.
A cold catch from the sea is a Polar Bear's favorite mealtime treat.
The Yamandon has the strength of 10 Bulls.
Cranes are endemic to the Tokuno Islands. Few survive captivity.
The Britannia Royal Zoo depends on the donations of Sosaria's fine citizens.
Changelings are known to imitate their predators and prey as a defense mechanism.
You must have completed the epic arcanist quest to use this ability.

The most destructive spell - Armageddon - was first learned from the wisps.
Mondain gained the Gem of Immortality after murdering his father.
Lord British established the Order Guards. Lord Blackthorn countered by forming the Chaos Guards.
Minax's army, led by Juo'nar, staged a war in Trinsic before it was saved by Dupre and his followers.
Trammel was created by a powerful spell cast by Lord British and Nystul.
Illshenar was discovered by a mage named Gilforn.
Orcs staged battles across Sosaria. The war was centered in Cove.
The gargoyle city, Ver Lor Reg, was discovered in Ilshenar.
Yew was turned into swamplands after Adranath's 'Decay Spell' yielded unexpected results.
There are Eight Companions and Eight Virtues.
Some Gypsies are as wise as the wisest sages of the lands.
The Virtues - are Humility, Sacrifice, Honor, Compassion, Valor, Honesty, Spirituality and Justice.
There are Eight Companions and Eight Virtues.
The Monks of Empath Abbey are reknowned for their wine.
Truth, Love and Courage are the three principles that make up the eight Virtues.
Gargoyles have their own language, called Gargish. Gargoyles also have their own principles and Virtues.
The Codex of Ultimate Wisdom embodies all that is to be known. One only has to open a page.
Moonstones were once used to travel between Trammel and Felucca.
Relvinian descended into madness while in the Hedge Maze.
Trammel and Felucca are named after Sosaria's moons.
Library Friends - Quotes from the pen of Sherry the Mouse
Oft have I wished that stranger would return.
A shard of a universe is a powerful thing.
Aid the nobility that resideth in human heart.
Yet sometimes one must sacrifice a pawn to save a king.
Even pawns have lives and loves at home, my lord.
But I am but a mouse, and none hear me.
We must bring the shards into harmony, so that they resonate in such a manner that matches the original universe.
Suddenly the shutters blew open, and Lord British fell to the ground, one hand shileding his eyes.
I witnessed them all from my tiny mousehole.
Library Friends - Quotes from the pen of Wyrd Beastmaster
I have not much to tell about dragons.
The fireball was massive enough to light a city I should surmise.
The sole time I approached one with an eye towards taming it, my initial attempts at calming it met with failure.
...the dragon suddenly whirled as if in a panic, ran a short distance, took off into the air, then transformed into a whirlwind.
I never did discover the exact cause of this strange behavior except to assume that it was not typical for this reptilian species.
Hence my basic advice to those who seek to tame a dragon-be sure that thou hast mastered the twin skills of taming animals, and running away very fast.
Library Friends - Quotes from the pen of Mercenary Justin
Be wary of a brazier that giveth warning when approached: thou canst use it to summon deadly creatures.
Deceit was once a temple to forgotten powers of old.
Do not investigate the iron maidens too closely, for they make suck you within them!
There is one place where a deadly trap can only be disarmed by making use of a statue that cleverly conceals a lever.
Oft one encounters the deadly exploding toadstool
Likewise, the very pools of water and slime on the floor may poisen thee.
The dungeon is mystically linked by crystal balls placed in different locations.
Deceit was once a temple to forgotten powers of old.
Wisps are the most intelligent of the nonhuman races inhabiting Britannia.
Library Friends - Quotes from the pen of Heigel of Moonglow
The wispish language seems to only contain one vowel, the letter Y.
The average word in wispish seems to consist of three phonemes and three glottal stops, plus possibly a pitch shift.
Wisps do make use of what sounds to us like pitch and emphasis shifts similar to exclamations and questions.
Some have speculated that what we are analyzing is in fact nothing more than the very air crackling near the wisp's glow, and not language, but this is of course unlikely.
Her name was Leyla, she said, and her hair was braided wild with creepers and thorns.
Her provenance, she told me over nights illuminated by campfires, was once the city of Trinsic.
Oft have I wondered of the boy named Japheth, and whether he remembers a girl who lived in sandstone walls.
Twas a fearful run, and I came to the road to Yew with welts and scratches run rampant crost my skin, but I did not see her again.
He had sandy hair like thee, and I dreamt as a child of holding his hand and sharing flavored ice. His name was Japheth.
...her smile seemed full of teeth sharper than a human ought to have, for the tale of orcish raising had struck fear into the marrow of my bones.

Can you hear them? The never-ending howling? The incessant wailing? These banshees, they never cease! Never! They haunt my nights. Please, I beg you -- will you silence them? I would be ever so grateful.

Some say killing a boggling brings good luck. I don't place much stock in old wives' tales, but I can say a few dead bogglings would certainly be lucky for me! Help me out and I can reward you for your efforts.

Nobody told me about the Mummy's Curse. How was I supposed to know you shouldn't disturb the tombs? Oh, sure, now all I hear about is the curse of the vengeful dead. I'll tell you what -- make a few of these mummies go away and we'll keep this between you and me.

You want to hear about trouble? I got trouble. How's angry piles of granite walking around for trouble? Maybe they don't like the mining, maybe it's the farming. I don't know. All I know is someone's got to turn them back to potting soil. And it'd be worth a pretty penny to the soul that does it.

Please, hear me kind traveler. You know when a knight falls, sometimes they are cursed to roam the earth as undead mockeries of their former glory? That is too grim a fate for even any knight to suffer! Please, put them out of their misery. I will offer you what payment I can if you will end the torment of these undead wretches.

It is a piteous thing when the dead continue to walk the earth. Restless spirits are known to inhabit these parts, taking the lives of unwary travelers. It is about time a hero put the dead back in their graves. I'm sure such a hero would be justly rewarded.

Imps! Do you hear me? Imps! They're everywhere! They're in everything! Oh, don't be fooled by their size -- they vicious little devils! Half-sized evil incarnate, they are! Somebody needs to send them back to where they came from, if you know what I mean.

The Terathan are an aggressive species. Left unchecked, they will swarm across our lands. And where will that leave us? Compost in the hive, that's what! Stop them, stop them cold my friend. Kill their warriors and you'll check their movement, that is certain.

I've seen them hiding in their webs among the woods. Glassy eyes, spindly legs, poisonous fangs. Monsters, I say! Deadly horrors, these black widows. Someone must exterminate the abominations! If only I could find a worthy hero for such a task, then I could give them this considerable reward.

Why must the dead plague the living? With their foul necromancy and dark sorceries, the undead menace the countryside. I fear what will happen if no one is strong enough to face these nightmare sorcerers and thin their numbers.

Foul brutes! No one loves an orc, but some of them are worse than the rest. Their Captains and their Bombers, for instance, they're the worst of the lot. Kill a few of those, and the rest are just a rabble. Exterminate a few of them and you'll make the world a sunnier place, don't you know.

Thank goodness, a hero like you has arrived! Brigands have descended upon this area like locusts, stealing and looting where ever they go. We need someone to put these vile curs where they belong -- in their graves. Are you up to the task?

A Solen hive is a fascinating piece of ecology. It's put together like a finely crafted clock. Who knows what happens if you remove something? So let's find out. Exterminate a few of the warriors and I'll make it worth your while.

Kind traveler, hear my plea. You know of the evil orbs? The wrathful eyes? Some call them gazers? They must be a nest nearby, for they are tormenting us poor folk. We need to drive back their numbers. But we are not strong enough to face such horrors ourselves, we need a true hero.

Vermin! They get into everything! I told the boy to leave out some poisoned cheese -- and they shot him. What else can I do? Unless…these ratmen are skilled with a bow, but I'd lay a wager you're better, eh? Could you skin a few of the wretches for me?

The woods in these parts are restless. Wrathful trees, walking about. Why, they're a menace to decent folk! And I'm running low on firewood, so what do you say? Could you turn a few reapers into some useful lumber?

Were you the sort of child that enjoyed knocking over anthills? Well, perhaps you'd like to try something a little bigger? There's a Solen nest nearby and I bet if you killed a queen or two, it would be quite the sight to behold.  I'd even pay to see that -- what do you say?

It makes no sense! Cold blooded serpents cannot live in the ice! It's a biological impossibility! They are an abomination against reason! Please, I beg you -- kill them! Make them disappear for me! Do this and I will reward you.

The universe is all about balance my friend. Tip one end, you must balance the other. That's why I must ask you to kill not just one kind of elemental, but three kinds. Snuff out some Fire, douse a few Water, and crush some Earth elementals and I'll pay you for your trouble.
I hope you'll reconsider. Until then, farwell.
Until you kill 12 Wailing Banshees, there will be no peace.
Go back and kill all 20 bogglings!
Uh, I don't think you're quite done killing Mummies yet.
You got rocks in your head? I said to kill 12 earth elementals, okay?
Your task is not done. Continue putting the Skeleton and Bone Knights to rest.
The restless spirts still walk -- you must kill 15 of them.
Don't let the little devils scare you! You kill 12 imps -- then we'll talk reward.
Unless you kill at least 10 Terathan Warriors, you won't have any impact on their hive.
You've got a good start, but to stop the black-eyed fiends, you need to kill a dozen.
Surely, a brave soul like yourself can kill 10 Bone Magi and Skeletal Mages?
The only good orc is a dead orc -- and 4 dead Captains and 6 dead Bombers is even better!
The Brigands still plague us. Have you killed 20 of their number?
I don't think you've gotten their attention yet -- you need to kill at least 10 Solen Warriors.
Have you annihilated a dozen Gazers yet, kind traveler?
I don't see 10 tails from Ratman Archers on your belt -- and until I do, no reward for you.
I'm thinking of building a small shed and the lumber of 15 reapers would be just about right.
Dead Solen Queens isn't too much to ask, is it?
You wouldn't try and just pretend you murdered 10 Giant Ice Worms, would you?
Four of each, that's all I ask. Water, earth and fire.
Your quest is complete. Return for your reward.
Finally, some peace and quiet! You've more than earned this reward.
Well, I don't feel any luckier, but there's sure a lot less bogglings about. Good job, my friend.
Nice work. Now, here's something for your trouble -- and this will stay between you and me, right?
Well, you're turned them rocky horrors into gravel, didn't you? You've got my thanks -- and this reward.
You've done a noble deed, putting these undead down. I only wish I could give you a greater reward than this.
The spirits are now at peace. Please, take this as a reward for your work.
Oh, I hope those little buggers are burning where you sent 'em! Here's a little something to fill out your purse.
My friend, take this reward for your work in driving back the Terathan hive.
I haven't seen a single web since you cleared the area. You've more than earned this.
Pleace accept this modest offer for your bravery in facing those undead sorcerers.
Mmm. Smells like dead orc, out there! Nicely turned! Fatten your purse with this, then!
You've brought a measure of peace to this area. Please, accept this meager offering as reward.
It's fascinating to watch the nest in action, isn't it? Here's something for your trouble.
I no longer feel their prying gaze of evil upon me. For that, I give thanks to you -- here's is your reward.
Hmm, looks like you've built the better rat-trap. Enjoy a little reward then!
Yes, I like these woods much better without the trees wandering about. Nice job.
Did you seem them run around? Wasn't that great? Here, take this reward -- that’s the most fun I've had in days.
I think Giant Ice Worms are a myth, don't you? Shh, I don't want to talk about it -- just take the money and be gone.
You've restored the natural balance friend and earned this generous reward.
You have not learned this recipe.
Twoja nagroda zostala umieszczona w Twoim plecaku.

To Be or Not to Beetle
Better to Be Old and Mean

I must implore you, brave traveler, to do battle with the vile reptiles which haunt these parts. Those hideous abominations, the Ophidians, are a blight across the land. If you were able to put down a host of the scaly warriors, the Knights or the Avengers, I would forever be in your debt.

There's been a bumper crop of evil with the Bog Things in these parts, my friend. Though they are foul creatures, they are also most fecund. Slay one and you make the land more fertile. Even better, slay several and I will give you whatever coin I can spare.

Psst. Listen close my friend, for I'll not speak of this again. Unicorns. You know them, I know them. I need a number of them gone. Don't ask why something you beautiful needs to be destroyed. If you can manage the task, I have the means to reward you handsomely.

It is regretable that the Gargoyles insist upon warring with us. Their Enforcers attack men on sight, despite all efforts at reason. To help maintain order in this region, I have been authorized to encourage bounty hunters to reduce their numbers. Eradicate their number and I will reward you handsomely.

You think you've seen destruction and horror, my friend? You haven't seen anything until you've seen what a Giant Beetle can do a nicely tilled garden. There's been a swarm of 'em lately. I don't have much, but if you could rid the area of a few, I'm sure I could find something to reward you with.

If I had but one wish, it would be to rid myself of these dread Efreet! Fire and ash, they are cunning and deadly! You look a brave soul --would you be interested in earning a rich reward for slaughtering a few of the smoky devils?

Is there anything more foul than a pixie? They have cruel eyes and a mind for mischief, I say. I don't care if some think they're cute -- I say kill them and let the Avatar sort them out. In fact, if you were to kill a few pixies, I'd make sure you had a few coins to rub together, if you get my meaning.

They aren't called Dread Spiders because they're fluffy and cuddly now, are they? No, there's nothing appealing about those wretches so I sure wouldn't lose any sleep if you were to exterminate a few. I'd even part with a generous amount of gold, I would.

Feel that chill in the air? It means an icy death for the unwary, for deadly Ice Elementals are about. Who knows what magic summoned them, what's important now is getting rid of them. I don't have much, but I'll give all I can if you'd only stop the cold-hearted monsters.

I should be trimming back the vegetation here, but something nasty has taken root. Viscious vines I can't go near. If there's any hope of getting things under control, some one's going to need to destroy a few of those Whipping Vines. Someone strong and fast and tough.

Ants are industrious and Lions are noble so who'd think an Ant Lion would be such a problem? The Ant Lion's have been causing mindless destruction in these parts. I suppose it's just how ants are. But I need you to help eliminate the infestation. Would you be willing to help for a bit of reward?
They're unholy, I say. Golems, a walking mockery of all life, born of blackest magic. They're not truly alive, so destroying them isn't a crime, it's a service. A service I will gladly pay for.

It baffles me how a Ratman can be smart enough to learn magic. But, I don't think they're so smart you couldn't kill a few. The beady-eyed fiends have been causing trouble in these parts, so I'd be glad to reward someone who thinned their numbers.

The flap of their leathery wings, the scratch of their reptillian claws, the clank of their scales. Keep your eyes open, friend for there are Drakes in these parts. The unwary find themselves a hot meal for the cold blooded fiends. I'd give all the treasure I possess to anyone brave enough to scourge a number of those devils from our fair skies.

From the foul depths, the Kraken come to torment men. The scaly horrors make life near impossible for us all. I know it may not be much, but I'd gladly reward any who were fearless enough to face the Kraken and reduce their host!

I have a business proposition for you, my friend. Caravans would like to move freely across our fair deserts except the accursed Sand Vortexes always attack them. If you could, say "disenchant" a few Vortexes, I could compensate you for your efforts in encouraging free trade.

These demon horses mock the bond between rider and steed! It pains me to see such despicable monsters in the shape of a noble horse. Please, execute these unholy mockeries, the Nightmares or the Fire Steeds, for me -- do this, and I will gladly reward you.

You've heard of a snake in the grass? How about a serpent in a lava field? Those fiery monsters cause no end of trouble, slithering and burning. Find a way to turn a few lava serpents into charcoal and I'll make sure you leave with a heavy purse.

Those frosty brutes! It's impossible to make a decent bonfire with them about! I'm talking about those masters of ice magic, the Arctic Ogre Lords. Yes, I'd certainly add a few coins to the purse of anyone tough enough to turn a few of those brutes into ice cubes!

Devils of snow and ice! They steal the warmth from our very souls! If only someone were brave enough to face the dread Ice Fiends and reduce their numbers, then decent folk might have a chance for once!

From the Stygian depths, the Daemons rise to torment poor humankind! I've seen them, cutting a swath of destruction through our fair land. But you, you seem a hardy adventurous sort. Perhaps you have experience in slaying foul daemons?

Corpulent foul-smelling brutes! Without their leaders, you're average ogre is such a menace. But as long as the Ogre Lords are around, they whip that unsightly rabble into shape. Hmm, makes you think we should target a few of these Orge Lords, doesn't it?

They watching me! Shh! They might hear! They've had their eyes on me for a while -- no, I'm not paranoid! Have you seen the way they look at me? Elder Gazers, indeed! Why do they observe me so? Please, kind traveler -- kill the fiends! Close their never-blinking eyes once and for all and I will gladly reward you!

My dear old mum, she does hate those awful Terathan. She'd like nothing better than to wreck their hives. Hmm, you know -- kill a Terathan Matriarch and the hive drops in efficiency. I wonder…perhaps someone who targeted a few Terathan Matriarchs would do some damage to the Hive. That'd sure make my old mum proud....

To live among giants is no easy task my friend. Take these Titans. Their appetites are prodigious, indeed. They consume all in their path trying to placate their enormous hunger! It leaves precious little for us to feed ourselves. I may not be wealthy, but if someone could kill a few Titans, I could afford to be generous with them.

You've probably slain your fair share of the common orc, eh? Orcs are a dime a dozen, but the Orc Brute -- that's a different story entirely! They're hideous monsters who've earned their deaths a dozen times over! How about giving the lumpen oafs the death they so richly deserve?

Does it seem uncommonly warm here? I think it does. I've seen Fire Gargoyles nearby. Those burning wretches turn to ash everything they touch. Do you know what does for property values? Do us all a favor and fight fire with fire -- kill some Fire Gargoyles for me.

Beware the White Wyrm, my friend! They are not a beast to be triffled with. I've seen them gut villages and swallow peasants whole! My hatred for the albino atrocities runs deep -- so deep, I'd give all that I own to rid the land of them.

Did you know Poison Elementals are corrupted from the very air? They are miserable wretches, cursed by foul magic. You do them a favor by destroying the noxious creatures -- they'd surely thank you, though you might not notice it for them trying to kill you. But, I could find it in my heart to reward you for killing poison elementals.

There is no greater foe than the mighty Dragon! A creature of myth and legend! A hero proves his worth by slaughtering the reptillian fiends! What? You're not swayed by my words? Well, would you be interested in a cash reward for killing dragons then?

Death all around us, like a plague of, uh, pestilence! Those undead magicians, the Liches, torment the living! And their masters, the Lich Lords are the worst of the bunch. I'll tell you, I'd give this large treasure pile to anyone who cleared these undead monsters!

Their girly bits are…exposed! There, out in the open, for any child to see! A succubus is an afront to all decency and morality! Someone needs to stand up for the children! Someone needs to teach the succubi a lesson in deceny!
The Gargoyles think they're the superior race! Their Destroyers are the pinnacle of their warriors! But I know, humans are deadlier by far and I'll pay you to prove it to the red-skinned wretches!

The Lords of the Underworld have grown bold! They march across the land, terrorizing and rampaging! But without their leaders, the Balrons, the legions of the nether realsm aren't nearly the threat. I could reward you handsomely if you could cut the head off of a demon army or two.

Oh, the cruel irony! A hero slays a dragon, only for it to come back as an undead monstrosity thanks to black magic. These Skeletal Wyrms are twice the fiend they ever were in life and it will take twice the hero to put them down again!

They say the Serpentine Dragons hail from far off lands. Well, that's just wrong. I mean, what, are native dragons supposed to compete with cheap foreign dragons? It's not fair! I think somebody should do something about it!

Every undead horror was once a living soul. Can you imagine, the poor wretches who become Rotting Corpses? What if some part of them knows what they've become? It's too horrible! Someone should return them to the ground.

The older a wyrm gets, the more deadly and cunning. The Ancient Wyrms are a treacherous breed, each one soaked in the blood of innocents. A hero needs to right their wrongs, eradicate their evil from fair Britannia.

Here's a riddle for you. Why hasn't anyone killed those annoying Sphinxes? With their puzzles and enigmatic ways, why we'd be better off without 'em all. In fact, I'll put my money where my mouth is -- kill Sphinxes and I'll reward you well.
Perhaps you'll change your mind and return at some point.
If you decide to return, I'll be waiting here.
Have you killed the Ophidian Knights or Avengers?
Continue to seek and kill the Bog Things.
There's still too many unicorns around, if you catch my drift.
I won't be able to pay you until you've gotten enough Gargoyle Enforcers.
Did you forget to kill Giant Beetles?
Those smoky devils, the Efreets, are still about.
There's too much cuteness in the world -- kill those pixies!
Dread Spiders? I say keep exterminating the arachnid vermin.
The chill won't lift until you eradicate a few Ice Elemenals.
How are farmers supposed to work with these Whipping Vines around?
Please, rid us of the Ant Lion infestation.
The unholy brutes, the Golems, must be smited!
I think someone should skin a few ratmen mages, eh?
A drake's almost a dragon but I still think you can take 'em.
Please, help stop the Kraken menace.
These Sand Vortexes make life impossible!
Don't let the Nightmares or Fire Steeds continue to walk this earth.
Those fiery serpents are still too many.
There's more Arctic Ogre Lords to kill, I'm sure of that.
I'm sure you can kill a few more Ice Fiends than that.
The Daemon hordes still need to be thinned.
Please, continue to battle the Ogre Lords.
What are you looking at? Go kill Elder Gazers!
Mum will be disappointed if you don't kill more Terathan Matriarchs.
I hope you haven't had your fill of killing Titans.
There's plenty more Orc Brutes who need killing.
Do not lose hope, you can face more Fire Gargoyles, I am certain.
The White Wyrms still trouble this land!
I beseech you, put more Poison Elementals out of their misery.
Prove you’re a hero -- kill some more Dragons!
Lich Lords still haunt our fair lands.
Do the decent thing and kill those horrible succubi!
There are plenty more Gargoyle Destroyers to, uh, destroy.
Balrons cannot be allowed to walk on the earth. Keep fighting them, please!
Reduce a few more Skeletal Wyrms to a pile of bones.
You've made a good start but those Serpentine Dragons need to be taught a lesson.
I can still smell the foul decay of Rotting Corpses.
Please, do no rest until those Sphinxes are properly schooled!
You have finished your quest and may return for a reward.
Your quest is complete. Return for your reward.
We can all rest a little easier with less of those slithery Ophidians about. You've earned this reward.
The land appreciates your efforts with the Bog Things. We should have a bumper crop this year!
Okay, here's your reward. Now, we never spoke, did we?
Those Gargoyle fanatics won't be troubling anyone any time soon, eh?
Tell me, do the Giant Beetles crunch when you kill them? Well, here's your pay.
Ha! Blown away like smoke in the wind, those Efreets are! You earned this reward!
The world is a less magical place, with dead pixies. Good job.
Thinking about those eight legged monsters gives me the chills! Here, take this reward.
You snapped that cold spell, eh? For facing the Ice Elementals, here's a little something.
With the whipping vines thinned, farmers can get back to work.
The Ant Lion infestation seems reduced. Enjoy this reward then.
Reduced those Golems to component parts? Good, then -- you deserve this reward!
Ha, the furry wretches' magic was no match for you! A dead ratman mage is worth something, so enjoy!
The skies have been clear of drakes lately, so I guess you deserve a reward.
There's hasn't been a Kraken attack lately -- congratulations!
Trade is up fifteen percent since you attacked the Sand Vortexes. You've earned a share of the profit.
You've cleared the stables of evil, my friend! So here are your just rewards!
For your work against the lava snakes, I have a little something for you.
It'll be a cold day in you-know-where when you can't kill Artic Ogre Lords, eh?
I already feel the warmth returning. Accept this reward for killing Ice Fiends!
Sent them back where they belong, eh? Good work.
The world will not miss those blubbery brutes. For what you've done, enjoy this reward.
Don't look at me that way. Just take your reward and leave.
Mother will appreciate your fine work. Here, don't tell her I gave you this.
The shadow of Titans no longer stretches across the land. Thanks to you!
Thanks to you for stopping those orcish louts. You deserve this rich reward.
You have extinguished the gargoyle threat, traveler. Thanks to you.
Those pale monsters are no more. Enjoy the rewards of the just!
You have performed a noble service. Here, please take this reward.
Dragons mean treasure my friend -- enjoy this reward!
I can only hope these undead stay in their graves once and for all.
Thanks goodness someone thinks of the children. Enjoy this token of our esteem.
The gargoyle menace has been thwarted. Thank you, traveler.
You faced the hordes of the underworld and overcame. For that, I will be forever grateful.
With any luck, those dragons won't be back again!
You sent those foreign dragons packing, didn't you? My thanks!
The stench of decay subsides, thanks to you.
You've rid the land of an ancient evil. My best wishes, friend.
Mystery solved! Enjoy your reward, my friend.
