An Updated History of Pagan, Volume I
An Updated History of Pagan, Volume II
An Updated History of Pagan, Volume III
An Updated History of Pagan, Volume IV
An Updated History of Pagan, Volume V
An Updated History of Pagan, Volume VI

Ages ago, in what is called First Epoch, there was considerably more land upon which humanity could walk. The Zealans, forebears to the Pagans, worshipped three who ruled the emotions. Amoras, beautiful and spirited, was the goddess of love and joy. Her counterpart was angry Odion, ruler of war, hate, and grief. Between them stood Apathas, he who controlled indifference, representing both the balance and absence of his two comrades. According to legend, these three gods and goddesses were responsible for bringing the emotions to light in their followers, though sometimes I think it was the people's emotions that resulted in the appearance of these Ancient Ones, as they are now called.

Though the Zealans were not known for valuing peace between their various tribes, one leader did step forward to unite them for some time. He was the great warrior Khumash-Gor. He brought his people together by conquering most of the other tribes and then integrating them into his own. The unified community grew and prospered under his rule, until he was assassinated a few decades into his reign. After the death of Khumash-Gor, the Zealans fell again into quarrelling tribes. However, not until the coming of the Titans was their culture ever truly threatened.

Many centuries after the fall of Khumash-Gor, a mysterious entity began to speak in the minds of the Zealans. At first, those who claimed to hear the unusual voice were ridiculed, but when the message began to foretell danger, others found a reason to listen. The words of warning came as a shock to the Zealans and to the Ancient Ones. No one had ever heard of the champion of evil called the Destroyer, nor were they certain of his designs upon the world. However, the few people who learned of the Destroyer spread their message quickly. They constructed the Great Temple and the black obelisk, while the Ancient Ones commanded those who still obeyed to wage war against this new religion.

The followers of the new order became known as Pagans. As they were directed, they began to concentrate their worship, through the black obelisk, choosing the very elements of earth, water, air, and fire as the objects of this worship. Soon the elements began to form into actual beings of tremendous power. When the Destroyer finally appeared, the four beings, the Titans as we call them today, rose up to fight it. During the terrible battle, the world was ravaged as the skies darkened overhead, the lands were torn apart by earthquakes and liquid fire, and the seas overcome by raging storms. The battle was long, but the Titans emerged victorious - the Destroyer was no more. However, the world lay in ruins.

The few people who remained gathered on this isle, which they named after the island's volcano, Morgaelin. It was a dismal time. The Titans began to fight among themselves for power. The wars between the few surviving Zealans and the Pagans continued. It was apparent that something had to be done, yet the question of what filled everyone's mind. After the defeat of the Destroyer, the people were faced with a great many problems. The wars between the Pagans and the Zealans were costing many lives, while the bickering Titans seemed almost worse than the Destroyer threat they had so mightily eliminated.

Foremost on the minds of the Pagans was how to handle the Titans -- no simple task, I assure you. Knowing they could not best the four, nor wanting to since they considered the Titans their saviors, the elders elected instead to bargain with the elementals. They built four areas and made them sacred to the Titans, one for each. A man named Moriens went to the Hall of the Mountain King, the sanctuary of Lithos. He spoke to Lithos and begged for the quakes to end. Lithos agreed, but demanded that he receive a boon in exchange. He bade that the people would be given to him upon their deaths to serve him eternally in his Pit of Death.

The idea of burial was first introduced as a means for the people to be conveyed to Lithos. Both sides accepted the pact, with Moriens granted the magical powers necessary to honor the Pagan half of the bargain. But as Moriens began to feel the effects of aging, another pact was formed, whereby Moriens could pass on his abilities to subsequent Necromancers - the term given to the mages responsible for sending the dead to Lithos.

Much time passed before Hydros could be placated. The hero and Necromancer Kalen found love with his Apprentice. Yet the Lurker, displeased that, unlike her brother Lithos, she had not the worship of the people, chose to take from Kalen his beloved. The angry Kalen sought the assistance of his patron, who was quite willing to assist in vengeance. Lithos told of a substance called Blackrock that could be used to seal Hydros within her Temple, for Hydros could not use her waves to wear down the mineral. Using his Necromantic powers, Kalen reshaped the Blackrock around the Temple and trapped Hydros inside.

Preparing to use the substance to completely remove all traces of water around the Titan, Kalen was stopped by the Lurker's pleas. In exchange for her life, Hydros agreed to return the body of Kalen's betrothed and confer some of the powers of Tempestry, the magic of storms and water, upon Kalen and all of his descendants. In addition, offered the Titan, she would end the torrential rains. Trapped even still in the defiled Temple of Flowing Waters, Hydros remains appeased.

More years passed and a wise man named Stellos was contacted by Stratos, Titan of Air, in the form of a mystic voice. She gave him the power to heal the sick and wounded. Kalen learned of Stellos' abilities and visited the elderly man. He brought with him the hopes of returning life to his beloved. Stellos spoke with Stratos and was told that much time had passed since the spirit was with the body. Only a great cost could she be resurrected. A giving man, Stellos agreed to pay the unknown fee.

He sent his spirit deep into the realm of Air and saw many unusual things. Finally, as the wizened man came upon a great brilliance, his body's mouth opened on the ground below breathed life into Kalen's beloved. He returned to his material form only to learn that he had forever lost his vision. So thankful was Kalen that he called upon the ground to form the foundation for a building, which Stellos opened as a place of study for those who wished to learn the tenets of Air. In addition, Stratos granted one further boon to the kind and gentle Stellos -- that of immortality! To this day, Stellos aids and teaches the magic of Theurgy upon the formation at Argentrock Isle.

Centuries after the miracle of Stellos, five Theurgists sought to quell the raging fires of Pyros, Titan of Fire. They took their knowledge of history - never forget the value of studying the past, my friend - and speculated that Blackrock might be used against Pyros as well as Hydros. They set about gathering as much of the dark material that they could, as well as collecting knowledge about the magics necessary to shape it. Drawing a pentagram upon the ground, the five began to call upon the Lord of Flame as ready to offer a sacrifice.

When Pyros appeared, however, they instead used a large chunk of Blackrock to bind him within. Trapped within the fragment, Pyros was unable to hurl fire from the great volcano, and to this day must perform the minor requests of those who possess the Blackrock. I am saddened to say that the Sorcerers, as they are now called, are misunderstood and feared - nay, loathed - by most Pagans. Considering the dangerous tasks performed by their predecessors, it is a pity that such people would be hated so. Ah, the effects of ignorance...

To anyone who will listen,
I am sending this warning ahead of me through the Ethereal Void. I have recruited wisps to carry my words far and wide. I am in dire need of help, and your world may soon face similar peril. You are not alone, and you are in more danger than you realize.

I am Mythran, scholar and arcane practitioner of a rare school of magic called Thaumaturgy. I am the last Thaumaturge on my world, perhaps the only one remaining anywhere. Someday, I will pass on the formulae and enchantments I have learned, but for now, I am alone.

I come from the fallen world of Pagan. Now named for those who conquered it, Pagan was once a beautiful planet ruled by another civilization known as the Zealans. Now, the main continent of Morgaelin sits in ruins, conquered by beings from beyond our world: the Titans of the Four Elements.

I know you are out there, across the Ethereal Void, unaware of the threat that results from being noticed by such powers. I saw your display of magic, a careless beacon in the night. With those spells, you both announced you had something worth taking and marked yourself as a potential threat. The Titans will now respond. They are more powerful than anything I know. They are likely a step ahead of me, and their cults and agents are already moving through the shadows of your world.

I am crossing a distance unimaginable to come to your aid, but I cannot claim altruism. What I am doing is not just for your world, but also for my own. With my counsel, it may be possible to save both our worlds. If you get this message, please respond.

-Mythran

Hello!
I have received the message you sent by wisp. I hope you will receive my response. I am Heigel of Moonglow, a mage from the world of Sosaria and a citizen of the kingdom of Britannia. I study wisps and try to share knowledge and lore with them. I believe we have much to learn from Xorinia.

A few months ago, my people cast a moongate spell as part of a conflict with another party who was misusing powerful magic. I believe this is the spell you were referring to. It created a connection between our world and a constructed locus. We often make use of moongates across Sosaria, but this was a rare instance where a powerful version of that spell was cast through the Ethereal Void. I will admit that this is not my area of expertise. However, I can get more information from my associates if you would find that to be helpful.

I admit that I found your words troubling. We have dealt with threats from the Ethereal Void before, but most of our magical study and practice focuses on manipulation of the physical world around us. Britannia has forces that can and will face such a threat, but it would be helpful to know what we should expect. Can you tell me more about these Titans?

-Heigel

Salutations,
I am sending a book of my world's history to you, along with this letter. If the pattern on your world is similar, the invasion will begin with whispers and promises of protection against a being known as the Destroyer. Worry will cause many to flock to this growing cult, who will build cairns for the elemental despots. These cairns will draw the Titans closer to your world. I hope you can stop them before they can build and empower a great obelisk to smash the threshold of your world. I do not know if any mortal power can stand against such beings.

I am travelling toward your world along a broken pathway created long ago. Using an Ethereal Travel spell of my own creation, I am making small hops across the lifeless void. The Dark Path gives me guideposts so that I can make my way without getting lost. It is difficult and dangerous work, so I have been returning to my home between legs of the voyage. My home is an extra-dimensional abode, sitting between Pagan and the Ethereal Void.

The gate magics you mentioned sound remarkably complicated, yet you speak of them quite casually. To complete passage to your world, it might help to know more of the esoterica related to your moongates.

-Mythran

Hello!
I never considered that an outside observer might find a Moongate wondrous. My people take them for granted and cast the spell frequently. The words of power are 'Vas Rel Por'. It requires three common reagents: Black Pearl, Mandrake Root, and Sulphurous Ash.

I have spoken to some arcane experts on my world about the fundamental nature of Moongates. An associate named Dryus Doost gave me the simplest explanation of how gates distort the fabric of reality. He explained that the shortest distance between two points on a piece of paper is to fold the paper so the points overlap and poke a hole through. Each time a Moongate is cast, it opens a hole into the Ethereal Void where our world's arcane geometry is more flexible.

Another mage, Gilforn, is one of the few people who has ever added to the permanent Moongate network. He wouldn't tell me much about how he created his gate. He mumbled something about being taught the spell by shadowy figures in a strange dream:

init kal vas gres
trak sek-de ter-mer..
re in ew tu-tim in-ten
re grav behi trak-por

However, Gilforn was helpful in explaining that permanent gates require a material focus when they are cast. He gave two examples. The first was when our king trapped a dangerous being in the Ethereal Void, he used a powerful moonstone. The other was the gate spell you observed which was created with a focus of four rare gems. Gilforn did mention that blackrock can be a good focus, along with a few other magical substances I did not recognize.

Can you tell me what your plan is once you make it to Britannia?

-Heigel

Salutations,
Your information on moongates was very helpful. It is similar to the way the explosive destruction of the great obelisk let the Titans into our world. The first part of my plan is to delay the creation of any doorway that allows more of the Titans' servants into your world. Hopefully, your people recognize the threat and work to stop it.

For the rest of my plan. I need your greatest warriors and mages to come together and be empowered with the magics of the Ethereal Void. These Warriors of Ether may have the ability to stand against the Titans before they lay waste to your world. I don't have all the pieces yet, and I need time to prepare. Last night, in a dream, a mouse told me that recruiting had already begun. I need you to figure out the rest of the rituals needed for the Warriors of Ether.

Good luck, my friend.

-Mythran
Spell of Ethereal Travel - Ort Grav Por

Reading through the many tomes of Thaumaturgy, the perceptive student is likely to notice something unusual about a few of the reagents. While a novice to any school of magic will find the names of most reagents unrecognizable, the reagents of Thaumaturgy are confusing for a simple reason. A universal collection of words and rituals must also have a universal set of material reagents, components that cannot be limited to a single dimension.Thus, the unusual reagents.

The casual reader will focus on the obvious questions: What are these creatures? A Dragon? A Newt? How many wings does one of these bats have? However, the trained mage will know that such details are irrelevant. Since magic is simply the manifestation of the caster's will rewriting the present, it stands to reason that the methods for bringing this will to the surface are not limited by the caster's plane of existence, dispelling magic notwithstanding.

Therefore, as it is possible to cast spells through a variety of means, the physical representation of the components are not relevant, assuming they enable access to the necessary energies. In such an instance, the thorn of a rose may very well be a reasonable substitute for the scales of a serpent.

Invoking this powerful ritual permits the caster to traverse the interdimensional realm known as the Ether. A mage's first few castings of this spell will prove awkward, for inexperienced mages will have difficulty determining their destination. With time, however, the mage will be able to dictate an arrival point and appear there. Note that this spell should not be confused with a spell of teleportation, for the former permits travel only between dimensions, while the latter permits travel only within a dimension.

The necessary components for this spell are hard to specify, for they seem to change depending on both the casting location and the destination. Usually the components include material native to both of the dimensions. In general, setting five pieces of the material - no piece smaller than a man's head - on the ground in the form of a pentacle and concentrating on one of the chunks, all while speaking the words of power, should permit the dimensional gate to transport the caster .

Animal Trainers Across the Realm Rejoice, New Methods of Animal Training Have Been Discovered

Animal Trainers across the realm rejoice as the Royal Britannian College of Animal Tamers has announced a breakthrough discovery in animal training!  Animal tamers can now train their pets in advanced techniques to make them even more formidable.
Shipwreck Salvaging a Lucrative Business? The Sons of The Sea in Trinsic Thinks So
This title is obtained by completing the Paladins of Trinsic Quest.

The Sons of the Sea in Trinsic is betting on shipwreck salvaging as the latest profession to line the pockets of Britannians with coin. Speaking from Sons of the Sea headquarters near the docks in Trinsic, The Town Cryer caught up with Salvage Master Hepler Paulson to get his take on this bold new business endeavor.

TC: Mr. Paulson, what can you tell our readers about the prospects of salvaging treasure from shipwrecks?

HP: Well, I can tell ya tis a bit of dirty business, and is a lot of work, but the rewards can be great! Just the other day I recovered a pillow!

TC: Erm, a pillow? That doesn't seem like a worthwhile effort, are there other treasures you've found?

HP: Uhh, well I found me some boots. Oh! I once fished up painting, got a bit of coin for that!

TC: It seems salvaging may have the potential to answer the mystery of what lies beneath Britannia's waves, are there discoveries yet to be made?

HP: Oh sure! Tis a big ocean out there!

TC: How would someone interested in salvaging get started?

HP: Visit me at the Sons of the Sea in Trinsic and I can get ya started!

Well, there you have it. If you think you have what it takes to become a master salvager visit the Sons of the Sea today!
Cleanup Britannia Initiative Launched, Officers Stationed in Britain and Haven

Has it been several months since you've seen the floor? Does your home resemble an orcish treasure hoard? Thanks to a well-timed edict from the His Majesty, the Town Cryer is happy to report that Cleanup Officers are stationed throughout Britannia to accept your unwanted junk in exchange for treasure! Visit a Cleanup Officer today!
Have What it Takes to Slay Britannia's Mighty Beasts? Join the Huntmaster's Challenge Today!

The Town Cryer recently caught up with Waylon the Huntmaster at the Ranger's Guild in Skara Brae to learn more about this elite monthly tournament.

TC: How does one enter the Huntmaster's Challenge?

W: Well, pretty simple really. Visit the Skara Brae Ranger's Guild and speak to the Huntmaster. For 5,000 gold you can purchase a hunting permit that can be used on any of the creatures showcased within the guild. Use the hunting permit on any kill of those species to document the size.

TC: Once a hunter has a documented kill, what can they do with the permit?

W: If a hunter is fortunate enough to have the largest kill for the month they'll win the contest for that species! A skilled crafter can also create trophies from any permit.

TC: What species are eligible for hunting?

W: Oh, we've got quite a few quarry! Everything from bears to turkeys. We even have some more exotic quarry like Myrmidex and Triceratops from Eodon!

TC: That's incredible! Such exotic creatures, what is the largest triceratops that has ever been hunted - our readers must know!

W: Once had a triceratops weigh in over 20,000 stones. Took several of us and more than a couple greater strength potions to lift into the hall!

The Town Cryer wishes to thank the Ranger's Guild for taking the time to inform us on the Huntmaster's Challenge. The Challenge runs monthly from the Ranger's Guild on the mainland in Skara Brae.
Capital City Gets a New Look! Britain Commons Opens With Expanded Services!

Another who wishes to walk the path of the Paladins of Trinsic? Well you should know the path is not an easy one to walk, and only those with the courage to pursue truth are admitted to the order. If you prove you are honorable, then you shall join our ranks and gain the prestigious title of Paladin of Trinsic. We are bound by Honor, and thus we stand against Shame! To prove yourself you must venture deep within the dungeon Shame and slay the vile within. Succeed in this task and you will prove your worth, fail and you will bring to your name what you hope to defeat - Shame.

The Britain Commons is now open for business! The planned redevelopment of the area southeast of the first Bank of Britain has now become a reality. Long known as one of the seedier sections of the City, the Commons now boasts a full complement of amenities. Most notable of these new amenities are the Vaults which are housed in the brand new City Vault. Citizens may now rent space in these vaults to store their most cenny possessions. The bank does warn customers, however, that any unpaid vault rental fees will be auctioned off to the highest bidder at the newly constructed auction gazebo. The new commons also brings a full crafter suite with nearby stable services and a large plaza to meet new friends and conduct business. The Town Cryer is happy to report that one of our dedicated staff will be stationed at the commons to keep Britannia updated on all the latest goings on in the realm.
Trade Booms as Bulk Orders Expanded to New Disciplines

Crafters throughout the realm rejoice as the Guild of Arcane Arts, Society of Cooks and Chefs, Order of Engineers, and League of Rangers announce their member merchants will now offer bulk order deeds to the Kingdom's crafters. This news was heralded by scribes and bowyers alike who now have the same avenues for business previously reserved for smiths and tailors. In a joint statement by the guilds, which also includes the Society of Clothiers and the Society of Smiths, they have announced access to new incentives available to crafters who participate in the bulk order deed program as well as new options to make obtaining those rewards easier. Crafters interested in taking advantage of new bulk order deeds should visit their local merchants today!
Warrior's Guild Publishing New Methods, Expansion to Knowledge of Magical Properties
The way of the Paladin is not for everyone, I understand your decision but hope you reconsider...

In a joint statement released by the Warriors Guild, Society of Smiths, Merchant's Association and Guild of Arcane Arts it has now been confirmed to the Town Cryer that recent rumors of a breakthrough in weapons, armor, and magical properties are in fact, true. The statement is reprinted below,

"For many years our members have been benefiting from the deep understanding our collective specialties bring to warriors, mages, and treasure seekers alike. That is why we are pleased to announce that thanks to the tireless efforts of our most decorated researchers we can report a new understanding of weapons, armor, and magical properties. Our colleagues at the Warrior's Guild have already taken this new understanding and incorporated it into execution manuals for a variety of special moves used by many in combat. This breakthrough will no doubt reshape how we all stand against threats to ourselves and our Britannian homeland."

When speaking with citizens of the City of Britain, home to the Warrior's Guild, the Town Cryer learned that many are excited about the announced discoveries and are already rethinking how they will kit themselves in combat, as well as execute training they have received in a variety of combat related skills.
Something Strange in Shame? New Treasure Underscored by New Threats
Go to the dungeon Shame and slay the creatures within, only then will you have the Honor of calling thyself a Paladin of Trinsic.

Adventurers venturing into Dungeon Shame will be met with new threats as well as a chance at new treasures, recent reports indicate. The Town Cryer met up with a band of adventurers returning from Dungeon Shame and we had a chance to chat with various members of the Fangwranglers:

TC: Gentlemen and Lady, would you kindly tell us a bit about your organization and what you experience in Dungeon Shame?

KO: Well, my name is Kal Ohmsford, of the Fangwrangers! We are a for-hire group of adventurers that perform a variety of tasks our clients ask of us.

TC: That seems like dangerous work! What kind of tasks have you performed, what kind of clients have you worked for?

E: My name is Elwin.

TC: Elwin..?

E: Just Elwin.

TC: Right...you seem like a very strong man, surely someone of your stature is well equipped to handle any task for any client.

E: We've done work for the Mages Guild and some other organizations. Usually there's something someone wants. We get it. That's it. Recently we've been working for the Paladins of Trinsic. They always need a hand.

TC: How has Dungeon Shame changed since your last assignment there?

G: Uh. My name is Gord. Shame is dangerous. No doubt about it. Great treasures to be had though.

TC: Interesting! And the forth member of your party, you are, m'lady?

KO: She doesn't speak.

TC: Oh, why's that? A bit shy?

KO: Nope, had her tongue cut out.

TC: Uh..

KO: It's like Gord said. Shame is definitely more dangerous. New creatures, new threats. But the loot is better too. Not sure what's going on down there but its great for guys like us!
What's Wrong in Wrong? Royal Britannian Guard Silent on Prison's New Tennants
You've completed a quest!  Return to the Lord Commander of the Paladins in Trinsic to claim your reward.
Citizens may be shocked to learn the Royal Britannian Guard has completely lost control of the Prison Dungeon Wrong. Details are still unclear
Scandal at Castle Blackthorn? Garish Dungeon Raises Questions
You have proven yourself Honorable, the Lord Commander looks overjoyed as you approach him triumphantly! Speak to him to claim your reward!

The realm rejoiced as King Blackthorn once again seemed to prove his prowess as the savior of Britannia, but a learned mage as well. In order to quell the threats posed on Britannia's cities by Minax's beacons his Majesty bound their evils under the foundation of his very castle! Initially heralded as an act of true selflessness, questions now abound regarding the true nature of that dungeon. Speaking on the condition of anonymity, a representative of the Crown had this to say, "Sure Minax's beacons have been bound in the dungeon, and per his Majesty any brave enough to test themselves against that evil shall be permitted to do so in order to keep it at bay. You have to understand though, folks want a little something for their time - coin, artifacts, fame...whatever it may be, folks expect to be compensated. The same goes for the Crown. As you know his Majesty is very active in research and the arcane arts, well the dungeon provides the perfect venue for that. Adventurers get treasures not available anywhere else, and at the same time our knowledge of the arcane arts advance."

The Town Cryer pressed on the ethics of such an arrangement, however our source merely belched after taking a strong swig from a bottle of ale. Those who wish to adventure into Castle Blackthorn's Dungeon do so at their own peril, but are sure to find Artifacts Bearing the Crest of Minax which the Crown has assured they will exchange for a variety of treasures.
Diabolically Lucrative? Huge Treasure Troves Confirmed
It seems the Paladins of Trinsic are working hard to see the threats of Shame are kept inside Shame, perhaps it would be a good idea to visit their headquarters in Northeast Trinsic.

Cartographers from the Maritime Guild have confirmed the appearance of treasure maps leading to a literal trove of treasures among the clandestine dealings of treasure hunters throughout the realm. Rumors of these maps have long circulated, however, The Town Cryer is the first to confirm their existence. The Town Cryer has also learned that a potential catalyst for the new encryption techniques used for the treasure location may stem from the influx of high end items pirates, brigands, highwaymen, and other hoarders are stashing in their treasure chests. The Maritime Guild cautions those foreseeing a quick payday - new encryption usually is accompanied by enhanced security at the location of the treasure chest. Those treasure hunters fortunate enough to come across one of these new maps are advised to take caution against the most difficult of wild foes.
The Virtues Revisited, Acknowledging Britannia's Roots
Find the Lord Commander of the Paladins of Trinsic.

When was the last time you visited the Chamber of Virtue in Britain? It is easy to lose track of the founding principles of Britannia, especially with our current King and his adherence to the tenants of Chaos. Even with the warriors of Vice and Virtue doing battle in Felucca's cities, the daily impact of that war is not felt by the majority of the realm. Those who devote themselves to the Virtues, however, will find themselves gifted with unique abilities. New among those gifts are those who walk the paths of Humility and Spirituality.

Teachings tell us Humility is the absence of Truth, Love, and Courage. To humble oneself is to truly put others before them, stripping themselves down to the most basic level. For those brave enough to embark on the path of Humility, they will find themselves facing Britannia's most dangerous threats without the protection of armor. Master this path and the power of Humility will in turn protect the Knight of Humility's pets by granting them immense regenerative powers.

Opposite Humility is Spirituality, or the full embrace of Love, Truth, and Courage. To be truly spiritual is to seek Love, Truth, and Courage from all the world and in turn truly know oneself. For those who embrace these teachings, they will find attunement and be handsomely rewarded for their commitments. The Knight of Spirituality can summon the energies of the world around them to absorb harmful damage and withstand the Szturm of an opponent.

These are the most recent revelations by the monks at the Chamber of Virtue, and all our readers are encouraged to visit the Chamber of Virtue and learn more about each virtue and the benefits of walking their paths.
Yearning for Domination Sorceress Takes Hold of Dungeon Covetous
A unique opportunity to join the Paladins of Trinsic.

Speaking on the condition of anonymity, the Town Cryer has learned from a source within the Lycaeum that Dungeon Covetous has come under control of a powerful sorceress with previous ties to the institution. This Mage, known as Cora, is well known to those within magical circles. What may shock most of our readers, however, is the violent past Cora had while training at the Lycaeum, her eventual expulsion and disappearance. Cora seems to have reappeared after that disappearance and has now bound all of Covetous to her evil magic. Reports from within Covetous are grim, to say the least. It seems that Cora has enslaved the creatures within to destroy the Lycaeum's attempts at channeling Cora's magics into what they call the "Void Pool."  While citizens are encouraged to avoid Covetous, those that dare challenge Cora's magics are said to do so at their own peril. Despite these warnings, many adventurer groups have looked to Covetous as the location of their next major pay day. In speaking with several groups on the roads to and from Covetous it would seem a bit of a contest has emerged among those who dare challenge Cora's forces at the void pool. To those who are skilled and determined enough to hold back her forces, cities throughout the realm have already recognized those accomplishments and have seen fit to build large triumphs heralding that accomplishment. Still, the Lycaeum reaffirms its public position that all of Britannia's dungeons are home to dark magics and unknown risks, imploring all citizens to only venture to areas protected by Royal Britannian Guard and official mages of the Lycaeum.
The Tragedy of Andros and Adrian
Speak to the Lord Commander of the Paladins of Trinsic located in Northeast Trinsic.

When brotherly love goes wrong, Britannia suffers. Dungeon Despise has become the battleground for a feud between two powerful twin brothers, Andros and Adrian.

The fathers of these brothers, both well learned in the arcane arts, lusted for the same woman. She was but a simple maiden, tending to the ranches dotting the Britannian countryside, her beauty, however, was without equal. Both men knew should they compete against one another, neither would succeed in bearing fruit with such beauty. So, the brothers conspired, and began to corrupt the very fabric of her love. Together the brothers conjured a powerful Polymorph spell to transfigure themselves into the perfect man for the maiden to love. For months they would deceive her love, the maiden unknowingly accomplice to a corrupt triangle. Finally, she gave birth to twins. Despite the powerful magics the brothers used to pursue their ruse, the mother's love for her children was too great and the brother's trickery was uncovered. Outraged at such a thing the maiden cast away her lovers forever, cursing them to the Abyss. As the twins grew and their mother aged they would learn of her hate towards their fathers. As each twin grew to adulthood and became their own man, they would blame the other for their own father's fate, and come to despise one another.

Already practiced in their fathers' art and fully possessing their arcane talent the twins began bartering with the mysterious Wisps. Eventually each convinced the Wisps to conjure an army with which to destroy the other. Their mother, bearing witness to this feud and knowing the dangers of the likely outcome, pleaded with her sons to reconcile. Corrupt with rage, there was no foregoing their anger and so she meditated at the Shrine of Compassion, hoping in her heart of hearts for her sons to end the feud. As she meditated a mysterious Wisp appeared to her and in an instant an eternal pact was made. The mother's love was enough to save Britannia from impending war, but her sons, filled with despise would be cast there forever...

This is the most shameful entry I will write...for I have fallen short of my goal. My only hope is my failures will serve to assist those who come after me with the courage to pursue the truth, and with my notes they will find success. I have found strange crystals on the corpses of the creatures I slay here. When I touch the crystal, I can feel it absorbed into my being. A growing voice inside me compels me to altars located throughout the dungeon. When the voice within grew loud enough I could no longer ignore it, I touched my hand to the altar and before me a grand champion stood! I was quick to react to the crushing blow my newly summoned opponent sought to deliver, and I was victorious! Alas, the deeper into the dungeon I explored, the more powerful the altar champions become and now I find myself in this dire situation.... To anyone who reads this...do me the honor and defeat the three champions and slay the unbound energy vortexes that inhabit the deepest depths of this place...for I feel my time here is shor...

Prologue - Introduction by Sherry the Mouse

After the death of Queen Dawn, but before King Blackthorn assumed the throne, there was a period of chaos, now called the Time between Crowns. After the defeat of VirtueZguba, the common banner against daemonic invasion was gone. Without leadership from Britain, the cities and towns were pulled apart by petty squabbles. Even Britain itself was torn apart from within. As humanity turned inward, they ignored their responsibilities to their allies

Chapter 1 - The Broken Bridge

Victor shares a story of chaos and despair and those who stood against it. - Sherry the Mouse

Travelling city to city as a wagon driver, I saw the chaos firsthand.

Many have heard stories about the Britain Riot, remembered for the looting and fire bombing of the original Castle Blackthorn. Arson and rioting were rampant. I saw someone attempting to set fire to Empath Abbey itself in a fit of rage! Some of this chaos was caused by criminals who were always outside the laws of Britannia, but much of the violence was caused by ordinary people driven to extremes by grief and desperation. The riots were more about bread than politics.

As our roads became more dangerous, the kingdom separated into feuding cities. Where were the rich and powerful during all of this? They were buying and selling any piece of Britannia they could get their hands on! Want to be a knight, dame, baronet, or duke? Each city was selling grants of title as quickly as the ink could dry. Many accepted the titles of leadership while doing nothing to lead!

There were those who tried to make things better. Those who fed the hungry. Those who protected the roads and cities. Those who brought criminals to justice. They saved us. One saved me. A ranger rescued me after I'd been left for dead on the road to Skara Brae. I'll never forget her or those who like her who got us through those dark days.

Chapter 2 - The Girl Who Woke Exodus

Balthan the Guide shares a story that illustrates the difference between intelligence and wisdom. - Sherry the Mouse

Callie never stopped moving. She was a stranger in our settlement, and despite exhaustion from her travels, she immediately asked to hire a guide. She had this giant backpack, filled with notebooks and tools, and when she sat by the fire, she pulled a dozen maps of Ilshenar from it. Callie needed a guide through Exodus's former domain. It was dangerous work, but I'd done it before.

During our travels, I learned that she was completing the work of her parents: a study of the magic and tinkering created by the being Exodus. This had led her to every library, mage circle, and tinker's workshop in the land. When she had exhausted that well of knowledge, she'd spent the last of her money hiring me.

When we entered the clockwork tunnels, Callie set to work. Despite the dangers, she pulled apart and studied every gear, gizmo, and glowing power crystal. She learned enough to repair the larger devices inside Exodus's mechanized lair. Those great machines had been left broken since the fight between Britannia and Exodus's false Blackthorn and the Juka. Her tinkering know-how guided us as we moved the large components and rebuilt the first Nexus device. When she activated it, we barely escaped with our lives as every golem and cultist in the dungeon converged on us.

This set into motion a plan by the mastermind machine itself that would return the scourge of Exodus to Sosaria. Later, others would duplicate her efforts and build unlinked Nexus devices in an attempt to stop Exodus, but their work could not completely undo what she had done. As for Callie, she was hunted down and killed by an agent of Exodus. Her knowledge of Exodus's arcane workings was lost as well.

Chapter 3 - The Waymaster

Argahrok, Shirron of the Juka, shares a story of unlikely bonds and the need to listen. - Sherry the Mouse

My tale starts with a nightmare.

I am a Juka warrior. I have stood in battle since I was old enough to hold a sword, and fear has never been a companion. Yet, thoughts of that nightmare send a chill down my spine. It was a horror shared by all Juka. It forced some of us back to the waking world, screaming, and some of my kin never woke at all. Each night for a week, the Meer and my people had visions of a battle that had never happened, a history forgotten.

Many of my warriors believed it a curse, a precursor to a larger attack by the Meer. However, my greatest scout, Waymaster Harlann, was not so sure. She disguised herself as one of the Meer and spoke with the other factions of Ilshenar. The gargoyles and humans were unaffected, but she found the Meer were also afflicted. With this knowledge, she returned to our stronghold, hoping to convince me to find the true source. She was almost too late.

Harlann was right that the dreams were an omen of something worse, connected with the Meer and Juka's shared origin. For when Exodus's machines came to life, they set in motion long dormant machinations. One of these was a contingency for if the Juka betrayed Exodus.

I did not believe her when she demanded that we abandon our fortifications. Great Mother, I was wrong! Our great fortress was torn from its place and cast back to where it came from. Many of my warriors were not able to escape and were pulled through the mana tempest. Older Juka in the vicinity, those who had arrived years earlier as part of Kabur's alliance with Exodus, died as two opposing timelines crashed together.

I would not have survived if Harlann had not pulled me, unconscious, half the way to Ver Lor Reg, before collapsing from her own injuries. If I had only listened, so many more would have been saved.

Chapter 4 - The Fall of Ver Lor Reg

Dupre shares the story of the desperate battle for the gargoyle city. - Sherry the Mouse

In the months prior to the manifestation of Exodus, the gargoyles of Ter Mur had reached out to their brethren in Ver Lor Reg. During the long history of the gargoyle people, there were stories of a 'lost' colony, cut off from Ter Mur by a cataclysm. Many believed this to be Ver Lor Reg. Queen Zhah invited the residents of Ver Lor Reg to leave the dangers of Ilshenar and strengthen Ter Mur. There was much debate in the cliff city, but in the end, other forces decided for them.

Ver Lor Reg became the location chosen to manifest Exodus in Sosaria. Its machine horrors and loyal cultists relentlessly attacked the city. The gargoyles fled when hundreds of machines forced their way out of the ground and shredded everything in their way. Ver Lor Reg was lost in under an hour.

I went to Ilshenar to lay siege to the city, but dire reports from gargoyle scouts made it clear we must storm the city. This was not the battle for Trinsic. There, we faced an entrenched enemy, but we knew our city better than they did. Here, the machines of Exodus had reshaped the materials of the streets and buildings along their own logic. We lost time destroying walls and barriers to get to the center of the city. Our scattered forces converged too late to stop the ritual.

The summoned Exodus itself was more of a threat than any of its forces. I worried if we were enough to stop the carnage. The unfamiliar terrain flanked us while Exodus relentlessly attacked. I had come to Ilshenar, expecting an orderly siege, but what I got was a brawl with a creature that stood stories above my army. It was a desperate fight we barely won. We did not realize the cost until later.

Chapter 5 - The Shattered Gate

The mage Gilforn shares a story of magic and moongates. - Sherry the Mouse

As Exodus was defeated, there was a powerful surge of magic. A secret that the daemon-machine took into oblivion is whether this was some malice or a malfunction of its dark core. The mana disrupted the Honor Shrine moongate and threatened the Ilshenar gate system, which had existed for hundreds of years since the times of Ulvol.

Initially, many thought it was a minor disruption, a mere inconvenience that would stabilize given time. When this did not happen, various experts on moongates and magic were consulted, including myself. What we found was far more troubling than one disrupted gate. While a single moongate distorts the fabric of reality to connect distant points, this ethereal aberration was a growing tear.

Many of us tried and failed to restore the damaged gate and heal the rip into the Ethereal Void. I will admit that I lacked the raw mana to sew together the ripped edges of reality. Some of the most powerful mages in Moonglow believed they controlled the raw elemental magic necessary, but those reckless attempts resulted in injury or the mage being pulled into the Ethereal Void.

Blackthorn's spell was ultimately successful in repairing the moongate. When I spoke to him about it, he admitted he had studied the writings of Nystul, Doost, and myself as part of his attempt to imprison Exodus, but it was not enough. The greatest living mage knew he did not have the mana necessary. In a desperate gamble, Blackthorn had made a connection with the Shrine of Honor itself, borrowing the energies needed to save that part of Ilshenar.

I can't tell you if he tapped into people's belief in Virtue, the Honor of those around him, or some primal good magic waiting in the shrine. I do know that he was successful where so many others failed. Greatness is sometimes the right combination of knowledge and humility. Oh, and magic.

Chapter 6 - The Great Gargish Blight

Princess Rhista of Ter Mur shares a story of Compassion and a mysterious healer. - Sherry the Mouse

Our gargish kin brought very little when Ver Lor Reg fell, but they carried with them something unexpected: the Blight. For those who grew up in Ilshenar, the disease was a minor childhood ailment, something that the generations had fortified against. For those of Ter Mur, it was a scourge that cut down even the healthy.

When the Blight started moving through the Royal City, my mother made the decision to quarantine the refugees from Ver Lor Reg to one distant corner of our land and all of those afflicted to another. I, myself, caught the wasting disease while bringing supplies to a remote fishing village in the quarantine area. Some will call my mother harsh, sacrificing even her own daughter so our civilization could survive, but I am not sure I would have made a different decision.

At this time, a stranger came to our land. We found this human unconscious on the edge of Ter Mur. Since his people were immune to the Blight, he volunteered to care for the afflicted. There is truth in saying that this mysterious healer saved our people. His knowledge of alchemy identified the ingredients necessary for the cure, and he helped organize the alchemists who treated us.

Still, he was not alone. Many, from all over Sosaria, came to our aid. There are some gargoyles who see Singularity as limited to the unity of the gargish people, but I saw that virtue in the faces of the humans, elves, and gargoyles who cared for us as we lay so near death.

Chapter 7 - Rebuilding and Homecoming

Heckles, the Royal Jester, shares a story of a happy reunion. - Sherry the Mouse

Blackthorn always was a fair boss. He gave me free rein in his well-stocked wine cellar, so even after all the stories about him, I felt it was my job to maintain his castle and other properties. During the Britain Riot, I valiantly protected his legacy by fleeing from the castle with the keys to the vault.

After the riot, things are a little hazy for a bit. I'm pretty sure I had a few drinks to fortify myself, but then it was time to get back to work! I set myself to the task of restoring Castle Blackthorn using various treasure that my lord had saved for just such a rainy day. The builders took Blackthorn's gold just fine and set to work. When it was finished, I did my best having it furnished as my lord would have liked. Since this was before Blackthorn's majestic return, some will ask why? Why did I do it? Well, a jester needs a castle as much as a king.

The day Lord Blackthorn came home was an event. People gathered across the bridge to see his arrival. There were no grumbles about the clockwork abomination that had stolen his face. This was Lord Blackthorn, Healer of the Gargoyles, Stitcher of Moongates, The Uniter. He seemed surprised by all of this, but he gave the crowd a wave and crossed the bridge into his castle. I was there lined up with the few servants I had hired. Seeing me there standing at attention made him laugh. Years of jokes, jests, and stories, and it was me trying to stand up straight that got the best laugh.

The stress of planning the coronation was a bit of a blur, but this jester kept busy and mostly sober. Sir Dupre was the one to finally put the crown on King Blackthorn's head. Even a paragon of restraint like myself might have shed a tear to see a crowned ruler again.

*hic* Wow! You aren't completely worthless! You made quick work of the creatures in the Dungeon. I'll be sure to let His Majesty know I handled it perfectly. By the power vested in me as the master of this bar I grant you this title, and some pull with the Artifact Agents! *hic*

Treasure Hunting sure does sound like an interesting profession! Think of the riches to be found! You'd have everything you've ever dreamed of! The Town Cryer article is fairly vague, however you have heard whispers of a mapmaker in Vesper at the Majestic Boat who may know a thing or two about decoding treasure maps.
A step closer to becoming a treasure hunter.
The Cartographer seems busy at her desk pouring over stacks of rolled parchment. You decide to break the silence with courteous *Ahem*

A treasure seeker then? There is no telling the lengths someone will go to protect their most cenny possessions. Over time maps to certain treasure troves have been found and their bounties recovered. The bounty within a treasure chest is directly related to the difficulty of deciphering the map and overcoming the protections of the chest itself. Cartographers use a variety of terms to describe the difficulty of a map that is drawn. This includes maps that lead to a stash, supply, cache, hoarde, and trove. Even the most basically trained cartographer can decode a map leading to a stash. The Cartographer can also discern the type of loot they might find based on the profession of whom the map belongs. Beyond that, however, some training in cartography is required. Once deciphered, the cartographer must find the location within the world and use a digging tool, such as a pickaxe or shovel to dig up the chest. Those skilled at mining will have a much easier time finding the chest, but it is not a requirement. The chest will be no doubt locked and trapped, so some skill with lockpicking and trap removal is suggested, although mages skilled enough may use magical means to unlock lower end treasure chests. Removing the trap with limited training will take more time. Finally, the chest is likely to be guarded by a variety of creatures that will attempt to defend the treasure at all costs, both following the unearthing of the chest and during the remove trap process. Combat skills are imperative to dispatch those creatures safely! Sounds like a challenge? Well it can be, but alas it is also incredibly rewarding and you will have a much easier time of it if you recruit other adventures into your budding treasure seeking business. Alas, here's a map I had lying around. You can visit the Adventurer's Supplies just on the mainland of Vesper to get some basic supplies.
Visit the Adventurer's Supplies in Northern Vesper, just across the bridge, and speak to the Master Provisioner to get some basic treasure hunting equipment.
A mysterious treasure map personally given to you by the Legendary Cartographer in Vesper
Visit the Legendary Cartographer at the The Majestic Boat in Vesper.

The Adventurer's Supplies is a large provisioner with many different types of adventuring equipment available for purchase. You spot the shopkeeper the Cartographer described and approach with a friendly greeting!
Find the location marked on the Treasure Map given to you by the Cartographer and use the supplies the Provisioner gave you to recover the treasure.
Expand your experience as a Treasure Hunter with a map leading to a Supply.
Complete your experience as a Treasure Hunter by discovering the final treasure hoard.

Use the book "Treasure Hunting: A Practical Approach" to help you decode the treasure maps you have been given and those that you find during your adventure and use the information contained within the text to aid you in your quest.
Given to you by the Master Cartographer

The Cartographer has given you a mysterious treasure map and offered you some tips on how to go about recovering the treasure. As the Cartographer leaned in and handed you the furled parchment, she told you of the origins of this mysterious document. "Legend has it..." she tells you, "this map is the lost treasure of an ancient Sosarian Order of Zealots. I'm told over the centuries they would bury small portions of their treasure throughout the Britannian countryside in an effort to thwart any attempts to recover the hoard in its entirety." Your eyes widen at the thought of a massive treasure hoard and you can't wait to find it!
Your time studying Treasure Hunting: A Practical Approach helps you decode the map...
*You decide to visit the Provisioner at the Adventurer's Supplies in Vesper before trying to decode the map...*
You have found the first zealot treasure! As you dig up the chest a leather bound case appears to contain an additional map. You place it in your backpack for later examination.
You have found the second zealot treasure! As you dig up the chest a leather bound case appears to contain an additional map. You place it in your backpack for later examination.
You have found the final zealot treasure! There are no doubt riches to be had within! Your experience has earned you a reward title that has been placed in your backpack.
This title is obtained by completing the Treasure Chase Quest.

Another rusted chest emerges from the broken ground at your feet! As you pry it open the brilliant shimmer of gold and jewels catches your eye. This map too is highly decorated with ancient runic text and marks another location for the hoard. You notice the magical creatures guarding the previous hoard were more challenging than the first, and you expect that trend to continue. With greater difficulty comes greater reward! On the reverse of the map is a short hand-written note,

For those who will come long after and discover this treasure, know you will never truly discover the extent of our wealth. If you posses this map you no doubt have some connection to our society, which has survived generation after generation. Use this wealth for what we have used it for, to be virtuous and good throughout Sosaria...

The note is very cryptic about the origins of these zealots and their beliefs, but from what you can gleam they are a long gone organization who's values were that of virtue and good. You are warmed by this altruistic purpose and decide to use your wealth to promote their cause throughout the realm as you search for other treasures.

Your eyes widen as you pry open the old chest and reveal the treasure within! Even this small cache excites you as the thought of bigger and better treasure looms on the horizon! The map is covered in ancient runes and marks the location of another treasure hoard. You carefully furl the map and set off on your next adventure!
*Your recent study of Treasure Hunting helps you pick the lock...*

Hail and Well Met! I am renowned Treasure Hunter Vespyr Jones! In this text I will give you the secrets you will need to become a Treasure Hunter yourself! Often times you will come across treasure maps throughout your journeys in Britannia. These maps can be obtained from a variety of monsters and even pulled up from the depths of the ocean! Once you've got your hands on a map you will undoubtedly notice the details the cartographer took to draw it. Maps leading to a stash are the easiest to decode while those leading to a trove require the highest levels of training in Cartography. It goes without saying that the greater the difficulty of the map, the greater the treasure to be had! A map will also tell the Cartographer the profession of whom the treasure belongs, useful information when trying to target specific loot. Cartography is one of only several skills the successful treasure seeker needs to uncover a hoard. Lockpicking will assist with unlocking secured chests. Remove Trap will handle any booby-traps meant to deter intruders. A complement of combat skills, or fellow adventurers to get your back, are needed to dispatch any treasure guardians enchanted to protect the chest. Remember too that more difficult chests are no doubt to be protected by the strongest guardians. Follow these simple rules and before long your pockets will be overflowing with coin & treasure! Happy Hunting!
A mysterious treasure map recovered from a treasure hoard
You must be on the "The Treasure Chase" quest offered via the Town Cryer to dig up this treasure.

The Governor of Minoc has made a plea to any and all of those willing and able to come to defense of the City. Cora the Sorcerers has overtaken the Dungeon Covetous and corrupted the creatures that reside within. You hear rumors the Governor has authorized the Sheriff of Minoc to bestow great fortune and fame to those who sacrifice in the name of the city.
Visit the City of Minoc and speak to the Minoc Sheriff.
An opportunity to serve the City of Minoc.

That's right, I'm the Sheriff of Minoc, what can I help you with citizen? What you read in the Town Cryer is true, Covetous has become quite dangerous. It seems a vile Sorcerers called Cora has overtaken the dungeon and corrupted the creatures within, binding them to her cruel rule. The Lycaeum had been trying to contain her magics within the dungeon with something called the "Void Pool" but the mage they sent has not been seen in quite some time. The place is dangerous to say the least and requires skilled combatants who will encounter greater success if they pool their resources. None the less, the Governor has authorized me to deputize any and all who sacrifice on behalf of Minoc and attempt to cleanse Covetous. As you know the mountain is a key strategic resource to valuable ore that is vital to Minoc's economy. Prove yourself to the City and you shall not soon be forgotten...
A step closer to glory for thy deeds...
Go to the dungeon Covetous Level 1 and defeat the creatures within!
You've cleared enough creatures to allow the miners of Minoc to return to their mining operations. Return to the Sheriff and report the news.

Indeed, you have proven yourself, and with your clearing of the creatures in the upper levels of Covetous Mountain our miners can once again return to their normal operations, ensuring the lifeblood of our city is one again flowing. You are no doubt brave and strong, but your next task will test your endurance no doubt. As I said, the Lycaeum is keeping Cora's power at bay with something called the Void Pool. The magics prevent Cora herself from destroying it, but her minions are not bound by that restriction. Only blade and spell can defeat her forces as they try to destroy the Void Pool. Defend the Void Pool at all costs and sacrifice for Minoc. Do this and you will no doubt be remembered a hero.
Go to the Void Pool located in Level 2 of Covetous and defend it from Cora's armies!
You have defended the void pool until your last breath, your sacrifice for Minoc will not be soon forgotten! Return to the Sheriff of Minoc and report the news!

Despite your failure in protecting the void pool, your efforts have allowed the mages of the Lycaeum to use their magics and bind the void pool in an infinite time loop, forever sealing Cora within the dungeon. This is only a stopgap measure, however, and Cora cannot be allowed to continue her twisted craft. Now comes the ultimate test, you must venture to the deepest level of Dungeon Covetous and slay Cora. It is the only way. Take this, it is all the city can offer you in an effort to slay Cora. The City is counting on you.
Go to the furthest depths of Covetous and slay Cora!
You have slayed the sorceress Cora!  Return to the Sheriff of Minoc and report the news!
You spot the Sheriff of Minoc! His mustache is characteristic of any good lawman. You approach with a friendly greeting!
You have fought valiantly and your sacrifice for the city of Minoc in defense against Cora's armies will not soon be forgotten! Despite your best attempts her forces have destroyed the void pool.
This title is obtained by completing the "A Forced Sacrifice" quest.

You have slayed the vile sorceress Cora! A powerful mage as she was, her armies will no doubt attempt to resurrect their general - for now though Minoc is safe. The economic future of Minoc has been secured and for your efforts you are hereby bestowed a great honor!
For your accomplishments you have been awarded a bonus 2000 Covetous points! Visit Vela in the Town of Cove to redeem them!
You are immune to Cora's Mana Rage attack while participating on this quest.  The immunity will last 3 days.
You must be on the "A Forced Sacrifice" quest to use this item.
This potion will aid you in your battle against Cora. The effects of this potion will last 3 days or until you finish the quest and can only be consumed once. Are you sure you wish to drink it now?

You've found the Royal Guard Captain! Speak to him to learn more!

You made quick work of those monsters! Well done! I'll send word to the Field Commander you are ready for your next assignment. Speak to him in order to get your next task. He's located just outside the Dungeon Wrong.
Well done slaying Fezzik, you may make a fine Guardsman yet! Speak to me when you are ready for your next assignment.

The mysterious wisp seems friendly. You are taken by the mysterious creature and it's iridescent glow. The wisp directs you inside the dungeon, but otherwise does not respond to your presence. You feel guided by your karma. Entering the dungeon with negative karma will draw you to the depths of despise while entering with positive karma will draw you up into the peaceful glades above. You have learned from the wisp you must venture inside the dungeon and seek an Ankh.
Enter the appropriate level of despise based on your karma. Once inside, find and use an ankh.
The Ankh pulses with energy in front of you! You are drawn to it! As you place your hand on the ankh an inner voice speaks to you as you are joined to your Wisp companion...

The Wisp surges with magical energy as a dim glow from its body illuminates the surroundings. It does not seem hostile. You decide to approach and attempt to communicate with it...

You have found an ankh inside the dungeon Despise. Touching the Ankh a wisp has joined you. Use the wisp to control creatures and train them to become powerful enough to challenge the Brothers Andros and Adrian.

Battling your creature against creatures of opposite alignment will make them more powerful, while battling your creature against creatures of similar alignment will make them less so. Different creatures have different abilities. When you feel as though you have trained your creature to maximum effectiveness, answer the call to battle and defeat the Brothers!

Mining efforts in the southern corner of New Haven have created a perfect safe hold for a variety of nefarious creatures. Earth Elementals and Lizardmen provide easy targets for the training combatant, while Ogre Lords on the lower level offer a challenge for those with the courage to test themselves.

Sometimes what's dead in Britannia doesn't necessarily stay dead. The Yew Cemetery, located east of the City, is one of the realms smallest but offers little in the way of magical creatures to deter the neophyte warrior. Skeletons make good targets for enhancing one's skill level and provide a modest amount of coin.

The Dungeon Covetous is home to one of Britannia's most feared threats, Cora the Sorceress. Fortunately the majority of her vile antics are contained in the more dangerous Levels 2 and 3. The first level of Covetous is home to a variety of non-aggressive creatures including Dazzled Harpies, Vampire Mongbats, Headless Miners. Only the Strange Gazers will show outward signs of aggression and care should be taken against their powerful magics. Feathers may be harvested from the harpies, as well as gold and gems from other creatures located throughout the dungeon's first level.

The Solen are an insect race that live in sprawling subterranean tunnels. Each individual follows a queen who provides the greatest challenge. Care should be taken when venturing into their habitat as other poisonous creatures such as Dread Spiders can be found within. The discerning adventurer incapable of curing themselves of poison through healing or magical means would be wise to bring a supply of powerful cure potions or a supply of orange petals. The Zoogi fungus that grows naturally in the tunnels is often in high demand by the Solen who will trade it for translocation powder.

This large Orc Fort has long plagued the Village of Cove to the North. Home to all manner of orcish kin adventurers should expect to face Orcs, Orc Captains, Orc Lords, and Orcish Magi. While none of these individuals are particularly skilled fighters, they can quickly hoard and overwhelm even the most seasoned of warriors. Care should also be taken against the primitive, yet effective, magics of the magi. Despite these hazards, the fort is an excellent training ground for young fighters looking to improve their skills.

Hides have long been the backbone of Britannia's tailoring market, and the pasture behind the Healer's Hut in Delucia is never in short supply. Even the most unskilled of fighters will find excellent training opportunities in harvesting the herd there. Hides can be collected with any bladed item and offer a steady stream of coin when traded to shopkeepers and other adventurers alike.

Unlike Britannia proper, the islands of Tokuno offer encounters with creatures not found anywhere in any other realm. This large swamp covering the southern tip of the Tokunese island of Homare-Jima is an excellent training ground despite its inhospitable conditions. Bullfrogs, Deathwatch Beetles, Giant Rats, Giant Serpents, Giant Toads, Kappa, Lizardman and Swamp Tentacles all inhabit the area. Some means to cure oneself is recommended against the often noxious deterrence these creatures employ.

Zento is the capital city of Tokuno, and its moongate connection to other realms make it a popular place for shopkeepers to peddle their goods. The City is also home to a variety of services that adventurer can take advantage of. To the north of the city is a large desert that is an excellent, yet more challenging, training ground for those looking to improve their skills. Bone Knights, Bone Magi, Deathwatch Beetles, Orc Captains, Skeletal Knights & Mages all take refuge in the sprawling desert. Several of these creatures are crudely trained in the arcane arts and care should be taken to deter against their spells. The adventurer must constantly be aware of their position and keep enemies at bay in order to prevent themselves from being overwhelmed.

Home to a brutish clan of cave dwellers, The Painted Caves offer great fame and karma to those wishing to make a name for themselves, as well as enhance their combat readiness. Few Glorious Lords and Ladies of the realm have earned such a reputation without challenging the Painted Caves. Trogdolytes inhabit the majority of the small caves and offer a moderate level of difficulty. Caution should be taken, however, against the Trogdolyte leader Lurg and his pet bear, Grobu.

Located deep within the Castle Blackthorn complex the dungeons are where the Crown claims many of Britannia's worst nightmares are secured. Magical transport directly into the castle is forbidden for obvious security reasons, so the adventurer must cross the moat and make their way to the dungeon entrance located on the western side of the complex. Once inside you will no doubt see the Agent of The Crown who will exchange artifacts recovered in the dungeon for a variety of wares. The Dungeon can be an unforgiving place and is home to creatures ranging in difficulty from paltry rats to towering Greater Dragons. Powerful magics protect the dungeon as well, and it is advisable to exit the dungeon should you need a break from adventuring. At the northern end of the dungeon is a containment area setup by Lord Blackthorn to contain Minax's invaders who besieged Britannia some time ago. Only the most seasoned of adventurers are advised to challenge these demanding foes.

Towncriers are stationed at all major banks and points of interest and will always have the most up to date news! Check often for updates and Happy Adventuring!

Greetings, Avatar!

Welcome to Britannia! Whether these are your first steps or you are a seasoned veteran King Blackthorn welcomes you! The realm is bustling with opportunities for adventure! Towncriers can be visited at all banks and points of interest to learn about the latest goings on in the realm. Many guilds are actively recruiting members, so be sure to check the Town Cryer guild section for the latest recruitment events.

We wish you the best of luck in your Endless Journey

So, you seek to learn the way of the virtues?

Walking the path of Knighthood in a Virtue requires devotion to the teachings of that virtue. All virtues are guided by the three principles...Love, Truth, and Courage.

Compassion is the pure Love of others. Those walking the path of Compassion will provide escort to those seeking to travel the realm. As a gift for thy devotion, fellow adventurers and pets that you resurrect will rejoin the land of the living with more health than normal.

Honesty is respect for Truth. Those walking the path of Honesty will recover items lost among the citizens of Britannia and return those items to their owners. As a gift for thy devotion, shopkeepers will offer a discount on their wares to those who are honest.

Honor is Courage to seek and uphold Truth. Those walking the path of Honor will engage in honorable combat with thy foes. As a gift for thy devotion, those who are honorable may pass unharmed among creature who would seek to do thee harm. Further, those samurai who are honorable may imitate perfection in combat.

Humility is the opposite Pride, the absence of Love, Truth, and Courage. Those walking the path of Humility will initiate combat without protection from their magical and physical protection. As a gift for thy devotion and owing to the shepherding origins of the City of Humility, Magincia, those who are humble can increase the life force regeneration of a pet.

Justice is Truth, tempered by Love. Those walking the path of Justice will hunt down and deliver judgement on those who choose to murder innocents. As a gift for thy devotion, those who deliver justice will find themselves rewarded with powerful scrolls when challenging the Champions of the realm.

Sacrifice is Courage to give oneself in the name of Love. Those walking the path of Sacrifice will sacrifice their reputation to redeem creatures who have lost their virtuous path. As a gift for thy devotion, those who have sacrificed for others will find themselves able to rejoin the living upon death without need for traditional healing.

Spirituality is to seek Truth, Love, and Courage from one's own self and the world around. Those walking the path of Spirituality will offer healing to those fellow adventurers in need. As a gift for thy devotion, the spirit can be summoned to offer protection, absorbing incoming damage from attackers.

Valor is Courage to stand up against risks. Those walking the path of Valor will challenge the minions of Champions of the realm and defeat them in combat. As a gift for thy devotion, those valiant can challenge Champions of the realm at their whim.

Looking to the Heavens: A Primer on Britannian Astronomy

The study of Britannian astronomy dates back to the appearances of strangers from offwordly realms. When it was learned that Sosaria exists within a much larger universe, curiosity tilted our heads upwards towards the sky. Before long skilled tinkers granted the ability to see objects at great distance became a reality - enter the telescope. While the most impressive example of these contraptions is the one located in Moonglow at 43o 52'N, 122o 4'W, where I have chosen to spend my time deep in research, recent developments in miniaturization have brought the size of these instruments within the grasp of the casual observer.

Using a telescope may appear quite simple, but one would be naive to think there is no more beyond haphazardly pointing towards the sky to make observations!

The best viewing hours are during the night between the hours of 5pm and 4am. Any standard clock is an essential tool in mapping the night sky!

While there are a variety of objects in the night sky to observe if one points their telescope at the object as it traverses space, the real search is for constellations - a unique collection of several stars.

Constellations appear at various periods during the night. Constellations can be seen during the early evening (5pm-8pm), late at night (9pm-11pm), midnight (12am), or the middle of the night (1am-4am). After 4am daylight will drown out any attempt at making meaningful observations.

Constellations can be observed in these time periods based on their location in the night sky. Britannian astronomers have adopted a coordinate system that uses right ascension (RA) and declination (DEC) to pinpoint a constellation's location during night time periods.

RA can be measured from 0-24 and DEC can be measured from 0-90. Current Telescopes are capable of resolving increments of 1 hour of RA and 0.2 degrees of DEC.

When a time period has been selected and the RA and DEC have been set one need only initiate a switch conveniently located in the viewfinder, to check that section of the sky! Should you be lucky enough to see a constellation a standard mapmaking pen can be used to create a star chart. As the potential discoverer of a new constellation you have the opportunity to name and submit your discovery to the Britannian Astronomical Society, of whom this author is primary registrar, for documentation.

Happy skywatching!

*tinkers with the telescope lenses* Comets tail! You startled me! Beautiful isn't it? There's nothing quite like the precision of a finely tuned instrument performing at its best as a sum of all its components - am I right? *chuckles* Astronomy, you know, is such a rewarding field of study. Sure, most of the graduates from the Lycaeum take up the more fashionable disciplines like Magia or Alchemy, but not me! You look like you've got a keen eye for the heavens - why don't you have a look at the table there and read my treatise on Astronomy to learn how to use a telescope? Or if you'd prefer you can browse the constellation ledger to see discoveries other astronomers have made.

Wow! Would you look at that! Always amazes me how even an amateur can make such profound discoveries! I've recorded your discovery in the ledger. Here's some items I think you have more than earned! Well done!
What's this? I haven't time for this! Star Charts only please!
Sorry to say that constellation has already been discovered! Fix your eyes to the heavens and keep up the search!

Auction Safe

In order to bid on an auction, players must have currency available in their account. Bidders can then place a bid for the maximum amount they are willing to pay for the listed item. Funds will immediately be removed from your account if your bid is successful. If your bid is higher than the current maximum bid yours will become the current winning bid. If you are outbid as the winning bid you will be notified by in game mail and your bid will be refunded to your account. On completion of the auction the winning bidder will have three days to retrieve their item from the auction safe or it will lost. Upon claiming your item if you have any change as a result of your maximum bid it will be refunded to you.
